Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: iOS utvecklare - PostNord App, Solna/Hybrid
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Vill du göra vardagen enklare för våra nordiska användare?
   

  

 Är du en passionerad iOS-utvecklare som vill ligga i framkant av den senaste tekniken? Trivs du med att skapa innovativa, användarvänliga och värdeskapande produkter? Då söker vi, produktteamet för PostNord App dig. Teamet är en del av PostNord Digital där teamen är självstyrande och jobbar i en välkomnande och öppen arbetsmiljö. Detta team ansvarar för PostNord App som används av miljontals personer över hela Norden där vi ständigt jobbar för att förenkla vardagen för våra användare.
   

  

 Som en del av teamet skulle du få jobba med bland annat:
   

  

* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteamet för att designa, utveckla och underhålla iOS-applikation med hjälp av den senaste tekniken och ramverken.
* Skriva ren, effektiv och underhållbar kod samtidigt som du följer bästa praxis och kodningsstandarder.
* Säkerställ prestanda, kvalitet och responsivitet hos applikationer genom grundlig testning och felsökning.
* Utforska, utvärdera och kontinuerligt implementera ny teknik för att optimera utvecklingsprocessen och förbättra användarupplevelsen.
* Arbeta nära utvecklare, produktägare och andra intressenter inom PostNord Digital.
* Håll dig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna och framstegen inom iOS-utveckling, ramverk och teknologier.


 Vi Letar Efter Dig Som Framförallt Brinner För Produktutveckling Och Förstår Att En Bra Slutprodukt Behöver Växa Fram Genom Nära Samarbete Med Dina Teammedlemmar. Vi Tror Också Att Flera Av Nedan Påstående Stämmer In
   

  

* Du har en kandidatexamen i datavetenskap, programvaruteknik eller ett närliggande område (eller motsvarande praktisk erfarenhet).
* Du har dokumenterad erfarenhet som iOS-utvecklare, med minst 5 års erfarenhet
* Du är väl bevandrad i Swift och Objective-C, med en djup förståelse för iOS-ramverk som UIKit, Core Data, Core Animation, etc.
* Du är naturligtvis uppdaterad med de senaste iOS-utvecklingsverktygen och -teknologierna, inklusive Xcode, Swift Package Manager, SwiftUI, Combine och Codable.
* Du har stor kunskap om mjukvarudesignmönster och arkitektoniska mönster som MVC och MVVM.
* Du är bekant med versionskontrollsystem (t.ex. Git) och agila utvecklingsmetoder.
* Du har gedigen felsöknings- och felsökningsförmåga för att identifiera och lösa problem effektivt.
* Dina färdigheter i kommunikation och samarbete är utmärkta och har förmågan att arbeta effektivt i en teamorienterad miljö.
* Du behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Flexibel hybrid arbetsplats med ett öppet arbetsklimat.
* Goda utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter, till exempel sponsrar vi dig att AWS-certifiera dig.
* Goda försäkrings- och tjänstepensionsvillkor.
* Friskvårdsbidrag och tillgång till kontoret Arkens gym och pool.
* Personalförmåner genom PostNords egen personalstiftelse PostNord Plus.
* Anställning sker enligt kollektivavtal.


**Vi gör vardagen enklare**
 PostNord är den ledande leverantören av kommunikations- och logistiklösningar till, från och inom Norden. Vi säkerställer postservicen till privatpersoner och företag i Sverige och Danmark. Vi strävar efter att göra vardagen enklare och mer hållbar för alla som bor och arbetar i Norden. Vi är ansvarstagande, modiga och engagerade, och leder effektivt förändring oavsett om vi leder oss själva eller andra. Vi uppmuntrar lagarbete, uppriktighet och positiva relationer på arbetsplatsen. Vi bygger vidare på våra framgångar och lär oss av både kollegor och misstag. Människor med olika bakgrund arbetar hos oss. Du kommer därför vara en del av en arbetsplats med stor mångfald, vilket bidrar till bättre resultat för verksamheten. Besök oss på www.postnord.com.
   

  

**Ansök**
 Vad väntar du på? Välkommen med din ansökan. Urval sker löpande så ansök så snart som möjligt. Om du undrar något över tjänsten, maila gustav.forsberg@postnord.com. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 För fackliga kontaktpersoner se Fackliga kontakter .
   

  

 #joinusatdigital

title: Product Designer
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 We are looking for a UX Designer to join our Design team. The primary focus of this role is to ensure that our users enjoy a seamless, intuitive, and enjoyable gaming experience on our platform.
   

  

 You will work closely with your manager and other UX designers to support the rest of the organization and enhance our user interface designs.
   

  

 If you are passionate about creating user-centered designs, making data driven decisions, implementing innovative features, and leading improvements for intuitive, and user-friendly solutions, then this is the role for you!
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Be responsible for driving the discovery design process of our platform
* Ensure we focus on the right things to build a better user experience
* Focus on the native app for LeoVegas in multiple markets
* Improve and maintain the applications with a multi-market product focus
* Be the backbone of our user engagement strategy


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 Essential skills:
   

  

* A minimum of 3 years of experience as a UX designer driving projects
* Well versed in the discovery phase of the Triple Diamond design process
* Knowledge of quantitative and qualitative data sources and knows when to use them
* Ability to provide findings with viable solution recommendations in an easily digestible way
* Knowledge of UX best practices with a mobile-first and responsive design approach


 Nice to have skills:
   

  

* Graphic Design Experience
* Proven experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows, and site maps
* Demonstrable experience with user interface design & ideation mapping tools like Figma, Sketch or AdobeXD
* Experience in working with software engineers
* Experienced with mobile apps


 WHO ARE WE?
   

  

 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices world-wide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Competitive basic salary
* Life-Occupational injuries & sickness insurance
* Possibility to enroll in an attractive private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution p/a
* 30 annual vacation days
* 1,500 SEK tech allowance
* Occupational Pension - Details on request
* Benify - A benefits portal with lots of attractive discounts
* Parental Pay
* Workation 4 weeks per year!
* Plenty of great company events
* Mobile phone & laptop of your choice
* If you are not based in the job location we will also provide you with a relocation package including flights and accommodation support
* Flexible hybrid working model


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Do you think you would be a good fit for the Leo pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Project Manager
description:
**Job Description:**
 We are Merkle Sweden - part of Merkle Northern Europe. Merkle is a leader in data-driven customer experience management (CXM), and we help the world's best brands deliver unique, personalized customer experiences across channels and devices. We provide expertise in digital analytics, customer experience strategy and consulting, user experience design, CRM, data management, commerce, content management systems (CMS), adtech and martech. We are part of Merkle worldwide and dentsu – a global agency network covering 145 markets.
   

  

 We are a global agency, so your role will be to have a broad, diverse set of responsibilities within a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
   

  

 As a project Manager, you will oversee, plan and lead client projects to ensure qualitative deliveries. You will focus on client needs, strengthening these relationships and ensuring that we exceed expectations in every aspect. You will foster smooth collaboration between clients and our team of strategists and specialists across various domains, including customer experience strategy, UX/UI design, A/B testing, data analysis, CRM, technical implementation, web development and change management.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Day-to-day client and team communication and management ensuring work progresses according to plan and ensuring client satisfaction.
* Manage project status and finances by updating reports and ensuring projects stay on budget.
* Scoping and planning of new projects
* Team resourcing


**Qualifications**
* You have 3+ years of experience in similar positions from an agency/consulting company.
* You understand the fundamental principles of customer experience.
* You are client-focused and understand client needs.
* Strong understanding of agile methodologies and their application in project management.
* You possess a strong strategic mindset.
* You have strong professional, organizational, and administrative skills, demonstrating proactivity to manage daily challenges.
* You find it exciting to be part of a client team, you manage to bring out the best in others and know when to delegate responsibility and when to take charge yourself.
* You have a good understanding and communication skills in both Swedish and English since both languages will be used in the workplace.


**About Dentsu Sweden:**
 Dentsu Sweden is part of a global communications network with 72,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting clients. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to Svensk Miljöbas, and we actively work with our social and environmental responsibilities as employers and fellow human beings. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion are deeply rooted in our shared values - the 8 Ways to Never Before - and our Leadership Framework is applicable to all our employees. We are proud of what makes us unique as a company and individuals, and we encourage applicants from all different types of backgrounds to apply to us.
   

  

 We offer, among other things:
   

  

* Collective agreement
* 5000 SEK in wellness allowance
* 30 days of vacation
* Flexibility and the best possible mix of two good things, working at our offices and working from home
* Many career and development opportunities


**Application and contact**
 Is your heart racing a little now? If you can see yourself in all this – both the job and being part of Merkle – we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 The position is full-time with permanent employment and is located at our Stockholm or Gothenburg office. There is no application deadline, finding the right candidate is more important to us than a fast process. The job ad will be removed after filling the position.
   

  

 For questions, contact:
   

  

 Maria K. Cederbrand, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner
   

  

 maria.cederbrand@dentsu.com.
   

  

**Location:**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Brand:**
 Merkle
   

  

**Time Type:**
 Full time
   

  

**Contract Type:**
 Permanent

title: Senior Strategy Consultant (CXM)
description:
**Job Description:**
 We Dream. We Do. We Deliver.
   

  

 Merkle is a full-service, data-driven customer experience transformation agency, we partner with Top 500 companies in the Northern European region. Our Merkle NE cluster consists of four markets: Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and the Netherlands, and we operate as one unified, leading full-service digital agency to serve our Nordic markets.
   

  

 Our 700+ digital enthusiasts are innovating the way brands are built by providing expertise in Digital Transformation strategy, MarTech platforms, Creativity, UX, CRM, Data, Commerce, and CMS. Merkle is a part of dentsu, a global network of over 66,000 passionate individuals in 146 countries.
   

  

 As a Senior Strategy Consultant, you are responsible for the development of digital business strategies, considering the end customer, organizational, and technology perspectives. You take on a role as a strategic lead for selected clients and develop concrete recommendations for how to better serve their customers.
   

  

 You will work on a broad spectrum of strategy projects – covering areas such as CRM, e-commerce, marketing automation, operating models, business transformation, and change management. At the core of everything we do lies a commitment to a customer-centric mindset.
   

  

 You are an expert in consulting our clients along all phases of the projects: from defining the project scope, conducting research, developing strategies, and creating roadmaps.
   

  

 Support and help drive interdisciplinary teams in large and international pitches and consulting projects with joy and confidence to the customer’s benefit.
   

  

 Our clients perceive you as a thought leader in digital transformation - you fill this role with joy and great professional confidence.
   

  

 Together with a team of highly qualified and experienced strategy consultants, you continuously develop our business consulting services.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* A degree in economics, business management, or international marketing. A higher degree is an advantage.
* 3-5 years of professional experience as a consultant in a strategic function in a professional services company, industry, a start-up, or a renowned management consultancy.
* Excellent knowledge of strategy development, underpinned by practical application of consulting methods and models.
* Strong strategic and analytical skills combined with a gift for communicating complex solutions effectively and experience in leading and delivering national and/or international digitalization or transformation projects.
* A customer-centric mindset and an understanding of customer journeys.
* Strong communication and argumentation skills, as well as a convincing and confident appearance at C-level with the customer. You enjoy presenting the ideas developed in the team in front of customers.
* Enthusiasm for several of the following topics: Innovation management, digital business models, transformation management, organizational development, process optimization, multi-channel models, data and CRM, e-commerce.
* Team spirit and a high willingness to always learn new things and mentor junior colleagues to help bring them to the next level.
* Very good written and spoken Swedish and English skills (business fluent).


**Goals:**
* Participate in and successfully deliver several strategy engagements for our clients.
* Strengthen client relationships and enhance satisfaction through well-thought-out and professional recommendations.
* Build and maintain relationships with relevant internal stakeholders, especially within Commercial, Growth, and CX.
* Be a highly regarded colleague within Consulting and across Merkle Practices.


 About Dentsu Sweden:
   

  

 Dentsu Sweden is part of a global communications network with 72,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting clients. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to Svensk Miljöbas, and we actively work with our social and environmental responsibilities as employers and fellow human beings. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion are deeply rooted in our shared values - the 8 Ways to Never Before - and our Leadership Framework is applicable to all our employees. We are proud of what makes us unique as a company and individuals, and we encourage applicants from all different types of backgrounds to apply to us.
   

  

 We offer, among other things:
   

  

* Collective agreement
* 5000 SEK in wellness allowance
* 30 days of vacation
* Flexibility and the best possible mix of two good things, working at our offices and working from home
* Many career and development opportunities


 Application and Contact:
   

  

 Is your heart racing a little now? If you can see yourself in all this – both the job and being part of Merkle – we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 The position is full-time with permanent employment and is located at our Stockholm office. There is no application deadline; finding the right candidate is more important to us than a fast process. The job ad will be removed after filling the position.
   

  

 For questions, contact: Maria K. Cederbrand, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner maria.cederbrand@dentsu.com
   

  

**Location:**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Brand:**
 Merkle
   

  

**Time Type:**
 Full time
