 Permanent

title: Senior UI Programmer - Dune Awakening
description:
We like to think of ourselves as more than just developers. We're a friendly group of around 500 people with plenty of casual and hardcore gamers, tech heads and creative masterminds, organized planners, and nerdy game fans who make this industry so fun. And we’re all together on a mission to open windows to amazing worlds. We've been making games for over 30 years, crafting and publishing unique experiences that have put us on the path to becoming a leader in Online Worlds.
   

  

 We've got five studios spread across Norway, the USA, Portugal, Sweden, and Romania, and we're always on the lookout for more dedicated people to join our ranks.
   

  

 We're all about creating a relaxed and equal workspace where flat communication and our agile structure are key to delivering world-class games.
   

  

 So, if you're ready to make your mark,
 ***we're ready to welcome you!***
 Your Mission in Funcom
   

  

 As a Senior UI Programmer at Funcom, you will use your experience both to improve the usability and accessibility of existing game features, as well as craft the user experience of features still in development. You will also spend time mentoring and supporting more junior members of the team.
   

  

 How you can have an impact in your position:
   

  

* Plan and implement UI systems for our upcoming DUNE sandbox survival game.
* Work closely with the UX designers and UI artists to ensure that UIs meet aesthetic and functional requirements.
* Careful attention to detail, especially with regard to compliance, layout, and design.
* Optimize and fix bugs in existing UI systems.
* Write robust, maintainable code.
* Mentor and support less experienced members of the team


 We are looking for you to have:
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in UI programming
* Experience working on PC or console games
* Good knowledge of C++ and Unreal Engine
* Strong communication skills (English is our working language)
* An interest in keeping up to date with the newest trends in UI in the industry


 We evaluate candidates on an ongoing basis and recommend candidates to apply as soon as possible!
   

  

 Please apply in
 **English** 
 .
   

  

 Why Funcom?
   

  

 At Funcom we're all about creating a relaxed, equal workspace where you can be yourself and really make a difference in what we do. More so, we're big believers in work-life balance.
   

  

 In our
 **Lisbon studio** 
 , over 130 people from 28 nationalities come together to work, play, and live their best life in the European city that’s the undisputed champion when it comes to most hours of sunshine per year.
   

  

 Our studio is located right next to the Tagus River, in an area with famous cafés and beautiful city landmarks.
   

  

 Joining our
 **Lisbon** 
 studio means that you’ll be greeted with open arms into a community of video game enthusiasts who are eager to help you thrive. Funcom Lisbon offers a flexible work schedule, relocation assistance, health insurance, meal allowance, gym discounts, social events, plus a long list of other benefits. Oh, and did we mention our epic table tennis tournaments?

title: On-site IT I&O Scandinavia Manager
description:
***Onsite IT I&O Scandinavia Manager***

  


***What this role is about?***

  


On-Site IT I&O Scandinavia Manager is a head of sub-cluster inside ONSITE IT I&O Austria, Baltics, Scandinavia organization.


In this role you’ll be primarily responsible for the management of Market / Factories / Leaf on-site IT I&O operations in Scandinavia, ensuring the delivery of all services dedicated to support of on-site users and provision of the infrastructure for running JTI business, such as on-site technical infrastructure maintenance, end user operational support, distribution of all IT equipment and network on-site support, as well as the delivery of required service levels as measured by objective KPIs and dashboards, following the established JTI IT policies and strategic directions. Regional On-site IT I&O operations are effective, efficient, adhere to the budget for the on-site IT I&O and strategic vendors.


This position also supports On-Site IT I&O Austria, Baltics and Scandinavia Cluster Lead in identification of the technical infrastructure & end-user computing requirements for market/factory/leaf business operations by cooperating with respective Regional, Markets, Factories, Leaf origins IT Leads to advise the IT Infrastructure and Operations Pillar for the required systems / solutions. The On-Site IT I&O Scandinavia Manager is accountable for managing the implementation and execution of all required global & local infrastructure systems, providing end-user computing services in incumbents' region locations.

  


***What will you do?***

  


* Work as a partner with respective Cluster/Entity IT Leads to fully understand technical requirements of regions’ business plans & priorities
* Liaise with respective Cluster/Entity IT Leads, Corporate IT pillars and other stakeholders to ensure alignment on the technical platforms/solutions required/scheduled for the locations
* Act as single and most senior point of escalation for the management of IT technical related issues and/or topics within the respective IT I&O Sub-Cluster
* Ensure technical solutions meet requirements of the business and IT, are cost effective, in alignment with IT strategy and the technology stack, implemented in accordance with Operating Guidelines and JTI P&P, and delivered according to plans; Provide visibility to respective Onsite IT I&O Cluster Lead where deviations occur
* Act as single and most senior point of escalation for the management of IT technical related issues and/or topics in a sub-cluster
* Management of the Onsite IT I&O budget for a sub-cluster (in technical areas) and within each reporting Market/Factory/Leaf onsite IT I&O sub-team. Responsible for effective planning of the AP/SP and LE processes, of delivering on commitments, and of managing and reporting with clarity how the regional budget is used to run existing services, the cost of transformation/change and efficiencies gained by changes. Optimize, control, and reduce costs, when possible, to improve costs/resource efficiencies and profitability within the regions
* Being accountable for regularly review of IT service delivery performance vis-à-vis standards and best practices, leveraging the IT performance management platforms for a sub-cluster, ensure appropriate coordination and communication with respective Clusters/Markets/Factories/Leaf origins to gain meaningful and actionable insights to improve service quality and performance efficiency
* Ensure regular maintenance of IT infrastructure in a sub-cluster to minimize business disruption and the timely communication of system changes to the respective Regions/Cluster/Entity IT teams for facilitating user readiness to adopt the changes
* Ensure a consistent application of computer controls that support financial audit requirements

  


***What are we looking for?***

  


* University Degree in Computer or Technical Science or strong IT background
* 5-7+ years of IT management (including people management) with more than 7 years of overall experience in IT discipline. Preferred background would be in multinational companies
* Knowledge of business and related processes in FMCG industry would be a huge asset
* High level of communication and negotiation skills
* Highly effective in a geographically distributed global environment. Cultural awareness with ability to prioritize on specific areas within region
* Proven people management skills; Strong ability to leverage resources and skills across a dynamic, cross-location environment, to maximize value and develop people, and to pull together a multicultural, virtual team
* Ability to innovate and think outside the box. Flexibility to adapt to changing business environment and priorities
* Proven project management skills
* Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities
* Financial and budgetary understanding
* Excellent knowledge of IT technology, infrastructure and business applications
* Able to deliver within tight deadlines and with limited resources

  


***What are the next steps – Recruitment Process:***

  


Thank you very much for your interest in the role. You are welcome to apply. We will make sure every candidate will receive a reply within 2 weeks after the application deadline.
company_description: We are JTI - Japan Tobacco International - and we believe in freedom. We believe the possibilities are endless when you are free to choose. #JoinTheIdea

title: 1st line systemtekniker till FinTech bolag
description:
Har du ett brinnande intresse för teknik och finans? Och är dessutom van att jobba i Linuxsystem? Då kan detta vara en ypperlig möjlighet att jobba för ett spännande bolag i en föränderlig bransch.
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, långsiktigt
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Så snart som möjligt
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Vår kund är ett FinTech bolag här i Stockholm som tillhandahåller viktiga system till ett antal börsnoterade bolag i Sverige. Nu ska de bygga upp sin 1st line support som stöttar dels kunderna med sina system men också kollegorna internt med diverse IT problem. Tjänsten utförs från kontoret alla dagar i veckan och tiderna kan variera mellan 7-18 inom teamet.
 


  


 Ni kommer vara ett litet team bestående av en teamleader, dig och ett gäng med kollegor som stöttar upp vid sidan av sina heltidsstudier. Det är ni som kommer ansvara för driften och supporten av att era kunders system fungerar som de ska.
 


  


 Tjänsten kommer vara en konsultanställning hos oss på Academic Work men där möjlighet till överrekrytering hos bolaget kan komma att bli aktuellt.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Löpande hantera extern support av företagets handelssystem med kringsystem samt med för IT Operations verksamhet förenliga arbetsuppgifter enligt direktiv från närmaste chef
  
* Mjukvaruhantering (installera och uppgradera/uppdatera mjukvara)
  
* Vara behjälplig med felsökning av och i handelssystemet och dess kring system
  
* Interna arbetsuppgifter kan introduceras senare
  
* Koordinera första linjens support
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Kandidatexamen inom IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet
  
* Erfarenhet av kundsupport/helpdesk inom IT i minst ett år
  
* Kunskaper inom ITIL-processflöde (ärendehantering meriterande)
  
* Kunskaper inom Linux (Debian)
  
* Goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Erfarenhet inom scripting eller programmering (PHP, Python, BASH)
  
* Kunskaper inom SQL (MySQL, PostgreSQL)
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Lösningsorienterad
  
* Samarbetsvillig
  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Nyfiken
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Nils Norgren eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sth2@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15108243

title: Senior Customer Success Manager (12 months Fixed Term Contract)
description:
**Company Description**
 LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.
   

  

 Join us to transform the way the world works.
   

  

**Job Description**
 At LinkedIn, we trust each other to do our best work where it works best for us and our teams. This role offers a hybrid work option, meaning you can both work from home and commute to a LinkedIn office, depending on what’s best for you and when it is important for your team to be together.
   

  

 The Senior Customer Success Manager (CSM) partners closely with their assigned sales partners to ensure LinkedIn Customers achieve a significant return on investment (ROI) and drive business success with their LinkedIn Hiring Solutions investment.
   

  

 As a CSM you will be tasked with:
   

  

* Serving as a Customer Champion and Advocate
* Helping Customers realize value from their investment
* Partnering on customer retention and expansion.


 The CSM will partner with various stakeholders within assigned customers, to ensure effective user and product onboarding and engagement on LinkedIn Hiring products and solutions.
   

  

 Responsibilities Include:
   

  

* Advance personal journey with Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging as this is a top priority for LinkedIn and many of its customers
* Partner with sales counterparts on prioritized customers to drive overall customer adoption, enhance customer success, and mitigate customer churn risk
* Act as a trusted advisor to the end users and their management to drive product adoption and ensure they leverage the solution to achieve agreed upon operational priorities, leading to full business value
* Agree on business objectives and goals with customers to build measurable success plans, set cadence of communication to deliver ROI and operational reviews.
* Develop new and innovative ways to share relevant data and insights that are impactful to customers and ties back to their success drivers through operational reviews to key customer stakeholders as well as Strategic Business Reviews
* Analyze current customer engagement metrics and leverage the Learning Center to provide new and ongoing product education options.
* Provide best practices to help drive user behavior and product adoption, and map Hiring solutions to existing customer workflows
* Maintain healthy customer engagement levels by identifying low utilization and providing solutions to further drive customer success
* Maintain an understanding of Hiring products and industry knowledge to effectively drive greater customer engagement on the most relevant features/functionality for their specific business needs
* Interpret customer insights to drive change in product and act as voice of customer to LinkedIn Product teams
* Expedite technical and purchase-related escalations.
* Document all communication with customers accurately and in a timely manner via system tools.
* Up to 15% travel may be required when travel guidelines safely allow for in-person visits, depending on location and territory


**Qualifications**
 Basic Qualifications:
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in any of the following: Customer Success, Account Management/Sales, Consulting, Product Training and Enablement, Project Management, or Change Management


 Preferred Qualifications:
   

  

* Recruiting or other applicable talent experience
* Proficient interpersonal skills, demonstrated by the ability to build authentic business relationships and effectively manage relational challenges
* Proficient organization, project management, and time management skills
* Experience analyzing data, trends, and client information to identify product or growth opportunities in service of customer value
* Influential verbal and written communication skills, including expertise in presenting to both small and large audiences
* Proficient understanding of Sales concepts and Software as a Service
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience


 Suggested skills
   

  

* Communication
* Stakeholder Management
* Data Driven


**Additional Information**
**Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates**
 Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.

title: Starta din IT-karriär i Östersund!
description:
Till vår konsultverksamhet i Östersund söker nu Centric flera kunniga, engagerade supporttekniker till en servicedesk. Uppdraget är på heltid och kommer att pågå tills vidare.
 



  





 Låter detta intressant men du saknar boende i Östersund så hjälper vi till med bostad.
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Du kommer att arbeta i första linjens support med att hjälpa användare via telefon och/eller mail med IT-relaterade problem. Bland arbetsuppgifterna finns hantering av konton i Active Directory, administration i Microsoft Office 365 och felsökning relaterat till Windowsmiljö samt kundspecifika applikationer. Ditt primära ansvar blir att ge support via telefon, mail och fjärrstyrning. Du kommer även registrera ärenden i ett ärendehanteringssystem.
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




 Du har ett genuint intresse för teknik och en vilja att ge bra service. Du kan förklara IT för personer på olika kunskapsnivåer och är en problemlösare ut i fingerspetsarna. Som person är du social och driven och har gått en IT-inriktning på gymnasiet.
 



  





*Krav* 



* Du har gått en IT-inriktning på gymnasiet
* Du har god teknisk kunskap och mycket hög servicekänsla
* Du talar och skriver både svenska och engelska flytande



  





*Meriterande* 



* Du har tidigare arbetat eller praktiserat med liknande arbetsuppgifter
* Telefonvana
* Kunskaper inom Active Directory, Microsoft Office 365 och Citrix



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
 



  





 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Linköping och Örebro. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Consultant - McKinsey Digital
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Who You'll Work With**
 You’ll be based in one of our Nordic offices as part of McKinsey Digital practice. This group brings together the best of McKinsey’s digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses.
   

  

 As part of this global team, you’ll be working on everything from IT modernization and digital strategy to agile, cloud, advanced analytics and digital business building. You’ll typically work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm. You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-technology topics.
   

  

 Our office culture is casual, fun and social with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 You will work with C-suite executives, problem-solve on their key issues and provide actionable recommendations leveraging your technology know-how and business sense.
   

  

 You will play an active role in all aspects of a client project, typically working in teams of 3 to 5 consultants alongside experts and partners of all tenures including developers, designers, data engineers, agile coaches and others. This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations. You’ll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.
   

  

 You will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on your teams. This support includes a partner from your local office assigned to help you guide your career as well as several weeks of formal training. Additionally, you'll receive guidance and support from your local office or practice in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Master’s degree and at least one degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering or mathematics; advanced degree or MBA is a plus
* 2+ years of post-university experience in technology- and strategy-related roles in a professional services, blue-chip, industry or start up environment
* Outstanding records of academic and managerial or professional achievement
* Combination of strong strategic and analytical abilities with a passion for technology
* Proven track record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
* Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively - both verbally and in writing - in English; fluency in the local language is an advantage
* Willingness to travel

title: CRM/DAM application support administrator
description:
**Company Description**
***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***
 At Sobi, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. We are dedicated to developing and delivering innovative therapies to improve the lives of people who live with a rare disease. Our edge comes from our team of people and our commitment to patients.
   

  

 Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team
   

  

* Competitive compensation for your work
* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


 We are now searching for a CRM/DAM application support administrator to join our IS/IT team. The IS/IT department is managed in-house and act as a strategic enabler for the implementation and support of business systems at Sobi. Make a difference for your colleagues! As a CRM/DAM application support administrator you will be part of the Digital Commercial Team, providing technical support, training, and guidance to our users and troubleshoot any issues that may arise in our Veeva CRM, Vault PromoMats and Veeva Network applications for the global Commercial and Medical organization.
   

  

 This position has high visibility across the company and interacts globally with affiliates, many departments at HQ and external partners. Sobi is a dynamic and growing company with a high pace of change. This requires well-functioning and up to date IT and business systems to support the high pace and Sobi’s business strategies, and to ensure that we are fulfilling regulatory requirements applicable for the pharmaceutical industry.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As part of our Digital Commercial team your main areas of responsibility will be to support and maintain our CRM and Document Management platform part of our Veeva Commercial Cloud, used by our Commercial and Medical teams. Your main responsibility will be to manage tickets and requests from our users in order to maintain these systems. As Sobi is in an exciting growth phase, there will be good opportunities to influence and shape this role.
   

  

* Provide technical support and assistance to our CRM users and resolve any issues or queries via our ticketing system
* Diagnose and resolve technical issues with our CRM system, such as configuration, integrations, customizations and performance
* Monitor and analyze the CRM usage and data quality and provide feedback and recommendations for improvement
* Escalate complex or unresolved issues to the CRM system Administrator
* Develop and maintain CRM documentation, policies, and procedures
* Train and coach our CRM users on how to use the system effectively and efficiently


**Qualifications**
* Experience working with CRM applications such as Salesforce or similar is preferred
* Strong interest in learning Sobi systems
* Experience working with Document Management applications such as PromoMats or MedComms is an upside but not required
* Knowledge about Veeva Open Data and Veeva Network will be considered is an upside but not required
* Knowledge about Veeva CLM, Engage and VAE is an upside but not required
* University Education in Computer Science, Business Administration, Project Management or similar knowledge
* Strong written and verbal English communication skills
* Experience from the Pharmaceutical industry is an upside but not required


**Personal attributes**
* Customer oriented with a drive to find the optimal solutions for stakeholders and users Analytical.
* Self-motivated and structured with ability to work on multiple tasks.
* A strong team player, with the ability to work effectively in a team and interact with people of different cultures.
* Can and will do attitude
* In addition, you must demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership.


**Additional Information**
**Why Join Us?**
 We are a global company with over 1,800 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.
   

  

 We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.
   

  

**Sobi Culture**
 At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.
   

  

 As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

title: Vill du bidra till att göra Sverige cybersäkert?
description:
Är du redo för ett spännande jobb inom it-säkerhetsarkitektur? Kom till oss på Finansinspektionen (FI)! Vi är ett engagerat it-team som arbetar agilt för att leverera tjänster till FI:s medarbetare, allmänheten och företag under vår tillsyn. Nu förstärker vi vårt cybersäkerhetsteam med en ny it-arkitekt inom it- och cybersäkerhet. Tillsammans bygger vi lösningar som motverkar cyberhot och på bästa sätt stöttar vårt uppdrag!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Du kommer att arbeta på avdelningen Arkitektur och it-säkerhet som idag består av tre definierade ansvarsområden - ledning och styrning, strategi och arkitektur, samt visualisering och operationell samverkan. Du är en del av vårt arkitekturteam som fokuserar på att effektivisera alla olika cyber och it-säkerhetslösningar från ett helhetsperspektiv. Du ansvarar för att driva och utveckla organisationens it-säkerhetsarkitektur, lösningar och processer, med fokus på infrastruktur och systemplattformar. Du tar fram och utformar it-säkerhetskrav, riktlinjer och arkitekturer. Du ser över befintliga lösningar, kravställer förbättringar eller arbetar fram nya lösningar för att höja it-säkerheten i våra it-miljöer. Du driver, leder och följer upp upprätthållande av förmågor och kompetenser gällande it-säkerhet och cyberrisker. Hela it-landskapet ingår, från infrastruktur och systemplattformar till applikationer.
   

  

 Du är nyfiken och brinner för lösningar inom it- och cybersäkerhet och tycker om att skaffa dig nya kunskaper. Du omvärldsbevakar aktivt och följer med i utvecklingen inom it- och cybersäkerhet.
   

  

 Du är van att arbeta fram nya it-lösningar i samarbete med olika roller för att säkerställa it-säkerheten utifrån kravdokument, lösningsbeskrivningar och riskanalyser kopplat till identifierade behov och krav.
   

  

**Din utbildning och erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har flerårig erfarenhet och gedigen kunskap av design och införande av säkerhetslösningar inom it-infrastruktur, server- och systemplattformar, containerbaserade tjänster och nätverk samt en stark analytisk förmåga att förstå komplexa miljöer och samband
* har flera års erfarenhet av kravställning, design, utredningar, stöd, rådgivning samt granskning av säkerhetslösningar och arkitektur kopplat till infrastrukturarkitektur och lösningar
* har erfarenhet och kunskap av att designa och införa säkerhetslösningar inom flera av följande områden: webbtjänster och webapplikationer (internt och externt publicerade), server- och systemplattformar (bl.a. Windows, Linux), containerbaserade tjänster (primärt Kubernetes men även t.ex. Docker), nätverk och mikrosegmentering, logghantering och logganalys ur ett säkerhetsperspektiv, integration och molnsäkerhet
* har erfarenhet av hybrida miljöer (on premise-baserade tjänster integrerade med molnlösningar)
* har kunskap om hotmodellering, riskbedömningstekniker och ramverk för cybersäkerhet (t.ex. OWASP, NIST)
* har akademisk examen inom ett tekniskt ämnesområde till exempel systemvetenskap, som civilingenjör eller liknande
* uttrycker dig väl på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


 Det är meriterande om du
   

  

* har erfarenhet från en större myndighet eller finansiell sektor i en liknande roll
* har certifieringar eller utbildning inom CISSP, CCIE eller liknande
* har kunskap om MITRE ATT&CK-ramverket och cyberkill-chain
* har erfarenhet och kunskap IAM/IDP-lösningar (bl.a. AD/LDAP, OIDC, OAuth2, SAML, med flera), och tekniker kring och val av autentiseringsmodeller, samt multifaktorsautentisering
* har erfarenhet och kunskap PKI-tjänster och begrepp, bl.a. TLS-certifikat, protokoll och ciphers.


**Om dig**
 I det här jobbet behöver du
   

  

* ha en god analytisk förmåga och kunna lösa komplexa uppgifter
* kommunicera tydligt med olika målgrupper
* ta egna initiativ som du kan driva vidare till realisering
* se framåt och planera ditt arbete utifrån långsiktiga mål.


**Om FI**
 FI bidrar till ett stabilt finansiellt system, välfungerande marknader, en hållbar utveckling och ett högt skydd för konsumenter. Vi erbjuder dig att arbeta med samhällsviktiga uppgifter, där du är med och påverkar den finansiella marknaden.
   

  

 På FI arbetar cirka 600 personer och våra värderingar präglas av att vi är engagerade, beslutsamma, målinriktade och hjälpsamma. Vår arbetsplats ligger centralt i Stockholm. Det finns även möjlighet att delvis arbeta på distans. För mer information om vår organisation: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/organisation/
   

  

 Verksamhetsområde It leder det strategiska digitaliseringsarbetet, driver innovation och ansvarar för internationell koordinering inom it. Vårt uppdrag är brett och vårt ansvarsområde sträcker sig från löpande drift, support och säkerhet till utveckling och förvaltning av våra system, projektledning, arkitektur, upphandlingar samt leverantörsstyrning. Här jobbar cirka 100 personer, fördelade på sex avdelningar och en stab.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Vi baserar vår rekrytering på kompetens. Det innebär att vi noggrant definierar vilka kvalifikationer som efterfrågas och sedan utgår från dem genom hela rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för mångfald och likabehandling och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Arbetspsykologiska tester kan ingå i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 På FI arbetar vi aktivt för att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare där du som medarbetare trivs och utvecklas. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på FI och vad vi erbjuder: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/lediga-jobb/vi-erbjuder/
   

  

 En anställning på FI kan innebära att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll görs enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

**Sök jobbet**
 Välkommen med din ansökan som ska innehålla cv, personligt brev och relevanta intyg eller examensbevis.
   

  

 Vi avböjer all hjälp med rekrytering och annonsering.
   

  

**Anställningsform:**
 Tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Omfattning:**
 Heltid
   

  

**Kontaktperson:**
 Helena Lejonklou, avdelningschef, 08-408 986 23
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:**
 2024-11-15

title: Junior Cyber Underwriter
description:
AIG söker just nu en Junior Cyber Underwriter till sitt nordiska cyber team. Rollen är baserad på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm.
   

  

**AIG, Financial Lines teamet & Cybergruppen**
 AIG kan som ett av världens största skadeförsäkringsbolag erbjuda dig en internationell och dynamisk arbetsmiljö med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter, både lokalt som internationellt. Att arbeta på AIG ger dig stora möjligheter att själv påverka din karriär och ger dig friheten, resurserna och det stöd du behöver för att växa och utvecklas åt det håll och i den takt du själv önskar.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i vårt nordiska FL team som idag består ett stort gäng Underwriters, utspridda inom ett brett spektrum av försäkringsprodukter som t ex Cyber, Kidnap & Ransom, Crime, M&A, Professionsansvar, VD-och Styrelseansvar (D&O), EPL mfl.
   

  

**Rollen**
 Tjänsten innebär att du kommer att arbeta med att utvärdera risker samt arbeta att prissätta dessa Cyberrisker. Arbetet innebär både en analysdel (utvärderingen och prissättningen) men även mycket kontakt med olika slags bolag samt lokala och internationella försäkringsmäklare.
   

  

 Nedan ett kort urval om vad tjänsten innebär:
   

  

  

* Arbeta tillsammans med seniora experter inom teamet i att utvärdera och prissätta Cyberrisker hos stora multinationella organisationer
* 
* Bygga relationer både externt (mäklare och kunder) samt internt (seniora UW-experter, våra skadereglerare och andra viktiga stakeholders)
* Supportera våra UW team i utvecklingen av ny affär
* Förhandla med våra kunder och mäklare kring riskbedömningen samt prissättningen


**Krav & Önskemål för att söka tjänsten**
* Utbildning inom IT, Juridik eller Ekonomi
* Någon erfarenhet inom försäkringsbranschen (antingen heltid eller deltid)
* 
* Intresse för Cybersäkerhet
* Behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Låter det som du? Kom och bli en del av vårt lysande Cyberteam och tillsammans leverera excellent service till våra kunder.
   

  

 Intresserad? Vänligen skicka in din ansökan via vår karriärportal. Vi ser gärna att din ansökan är på engelska.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring positionen är du välkommen att kontakta:
   

  

  

* Chris la Cour Valentin / Nordic Cyber Practice Lead / chris.valentin@aig.com or
* Jasmin Eriksson / Junior HR Generalist, Nordics / jasmin.eriksson@aig.com


 Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande så vänta inte med din ansökan.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. Building on 100 years of experience, today AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance, life insurance, retirement solutions, and other financial services to customers in more than 80 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets, manage risks and provide for retirement security.
   

  

**Get to know the business**
 General Insurance is a leading provider of insurance products and services for commercial and personal insurance customers. It includes one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. General Insurance offers a broad range of products to customers through
   

  

 a diversified, multichannel distribution network.
   

  

**Reimagining insurance to make a bigger difference to the world**
 American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a global leader in commercial and personal insurance solutions; we are one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. It is an exciting time to join us — across our operations, we are thinking in new and innovative ways to deliver ever-better solutions to our customers. At AIG, you can go further to support individuals, businesses, and communities, helping them to manage risk, respond to times of uncertainty and discover new potential. We invest in our largest asset, our people, through continuous learning and development, in a culture that celebrates everyone for who they are and what they want to become.
   

  

**Welcome to a culture of belonging**
 We’re committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through our flexible work arrangements, diversity and inclusion learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The diversity of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.
   

  

*AIG provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.*
 AIG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants and employees with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation, please send an email to candidatecare@aig.com.
   

  

 Functional Area:
   

  

 UW - Underwriting
   

  

 Estimated Travel Percentage (%): Up to 25%
   

  

 Relocation Provided: No
   

  

 AIG Europe S.A Filial i Sverige

title: Account Executive, Enterprise (Sweden)
company_industry: Computer Hardware Manufacturing and Software Development
description:
**BE PART OF BUILDING THE FUTURE.**
 What do NASA and emerging space companies have in common with COVID vaccine R&D teams or with Roblox and the Metaverse?
   

  

 The answer is data, -- all fast moving, fast growing industries rely on data for a competitive edge in their industries. And the most advanced companies are realizing the full data advantage by partnering with Pure Storage. Pure’s vision is to redefine the storage experience and empower innovators by simplifying how people consume and interact with data. With 11,000+ customers including 58% of the Fortune 500, we’ve only scratched the surface of our ambitions.
   

  

**Pure Is Blazing Trails And Setting Records**
* For ten straight years, Gartner has named Pure a leader in the Magic Quadrant
* Our customer-first culture and unwavering commitment to innovation have earned us a certified Net Promoter Score in the top 1% of B2B companies globally
* Industry analysts and press applaud Pure’s leadership across these dimensions
* And, our 5,000+ employees are emboldened to make Pure a faster, stronger, smarter company as we go


 If you, like us, say “bring it on” to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.
   

  

**SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE...**
 Pure Storage is seeking an experienced Account Executive to join the Enterprise Sales team in Sweden. In this role, you will be responsible for prospecting and
 **developing business with new customers** 
 selling the full portfolio of PURE’s offerings, within the
 **Banking and Finance** 
 sectors. You will work with our channel resellers in an indirect sales motion and interact directly with key customer accounts. You will also collaborate with the Sales, Pre-sales, Partner sales, and Field Marketing team to develop business with new and existing customers in the assigned account list.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing...**
* Evangelize our radically simple, all-flash enterprise storage technology and data solutions, ensuring customers fully grasp Pure’s total value proposition
* Build and invest in relationships with customers to establish Pure’s value, continually driving the highest customer satisfaction ratings in the industry
* Lead pursuit teams and develop account plans to make sure all internal resources are engaged to execute and win new Pure Customers
* Drive and manage a healthy and robust pipeline of sales activity to assure quarterly and annual quotas are met or exceeded
* Work closely with a network of Channel, GSI and Ecosystem Partners to successfully position and sell the Pure Storage platform in your assigned accounts.
* Create and execute account strategies and coordinate team selling efforts with partners to accurately forecast and close business on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis.
* Deliver results; exceeding annual quotas, driving referenceable business and building consistent pipeline through effective prospecting and marketing initiatives.
* Develop and present comprehensive proposals to customers, articulating the business outcomes and benefits to be realized with the Pure Storage platform.
* You will always be earning the right to be our customers & partners first choice.


**What You’ll Need To Bring To This Role...**
* Enterprise SaaS sales experience highly desirable.
* Passion for sales and business development with a team spirit, relationship building and customer business outcome focused.
* Solid experience with Enterprise accounts.
* A Banking & Finance sector focus.
* Proven experience working closely with a network of Channel, GSI and Ecosystem Partners to successfully position, market and sell the Pure Storage platform in your assigned accounts.
* Advanced prospection skills with an excellent capacity to engage with new customers
* An ambitious/goal-oriented attitude, a strong work ethic, a desire to disrupt the status quo, drive change and evangelize new technologies.
* Proven track record in delivering results; exceeding annual quotas, driving referenceable business and building consistent pipeline through effective prospecting and marketing initiatives.
* The ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment is key, a blend of large company and startup experience.
* Knowledge of the cloud computing industry & data management, or current and next-generation business applications, predominantly on customer premises with cloud storage understanding.
* An understanding of the overall Data Centre Architecture including Fabric, Network, Virtual Server and virtual desktop environments, databases and disaster recovery.
* Excellent time management and communication skills.
* Proficient with Salesforce.com and Google Workspace (preferred, not required).
* Minimum of 8-10 years of field sales experience.
* Must be willing and able to work in an open office, team environment.
* Native/Bilingual Swedish and business professional English Required.


**BE YOU—CORPORATE CLONES NEED NOT APPLY.**
 Pure is where you ask big questions, think differently, and make an impact. This is not just a job, but a place where you have a voice and can accelerate your career. We value unique thoughts and celebrate individuality, and with ample opportunity to learn, develop yourself, and expand into different roles, joining Pure is an investment in your career journey.
   

  

 Through our Pure Equality program, which supports a flourishing field of employee resource groups, we nourish the personal and professional lives of our team members. And our Pure Good Foundation gives back to local and global communities through volunteering and grants.
   

  

 And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources, and company-sponsored team events.
   

  

**PURE IS COMMITTED TO EQUALITY.**
 Research shows that in order to apply for a job, women feel they need to meet 100% of the criteria while men usually apply after meeting about 60%. Regardless of how you identify, if you believe you can do the job and are a good match, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

 Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire.
   

  

 If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at
 **TA-Ops@purestorage.com** 
 .
   

  

**APPLICANT & CANDIDATE PERSONAL INFORMATION PRIVACY NOTICE.**
 If you're wondering how or why Pure collects or uses information you provide, we invite you to check out our Applicant & Candidate Personal Information Protection Notice.
   

  

**DEEMED EXPORT LICENSE NOTICE.**
 Some positions may require a deemed export license for compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Please note: Pure does not currently sponsor deemed export license applications so we are unable to proceed with applicants requiring stated sponsorship.

title: ICT Lead Auditor
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About Business Assurance**
 We help companies ensure compliance, build high-performing management systems, and meet competence needs within a wide range of industries. DNV helps companies understand Working with us, you can be involved in technically challenging and innovative projects worldwide demanding a broad variety of expertise. Our strong focus on research and innovation opens an array of opportunities, and allows you to engage in projects which develop next generation solutions. and manage their risk picture through our management system certification and training portfolios.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a result of further growth of our Business Assurance Unit in Sweden we are looking for qualified
 **Lead Auditors** 
 within the
 **Information Security ISO 27001** 
 area, preferably combined with ISO 9001.
   

  

 As a
 **Lead Auditor** 
 you will be part of our team of auditors. Your assignments will be performing audits according to standards for information security – normally at the customer’s premises - in a wide variety of industries.
   

  

 You will be part of a professional team of colleagues with experience in many industries. As a Lead Auditor you will work both independently and in multidisciplinary teams.
   

  

**The Assignment May Include**
* Performing audits for Swedish and international clients
* Project management of larger certification projects
* Development of new services, training services, etc. on an ad hoc basis
* Supporting sales team and contributing to sales revenue.


 What we offer
   

  

 In DNV we are proud to lead the development in our main industries. Whether we work with some of the world’s leading companies to help solve some of their risk or safety challenges or we initiate joint industry projects to solve an industry-wide technical issue, we always aim to deliver expert insight and value to our customers and stakeholders. You will work with experts from a wide range of disciplines and build your competence, problem-solving abilities. It will broaden your view.
   

  

**We offer**
* A strong company culture with an emphasis on competence development
* Great colleagues who value teamwork and support
* Attractive total compensation package
* International working environment
* Flexible working hours and focus on work/life balance
* Interesting and challenging customers and projects, both national and international
* Be part of a world-leading company that has a global reach with more than 12 000 employees around to world and is headquartered in Norway.
* The possibility to grow and develop your competencies and ambitions within DNV.


**Requirements**
 About you
   

  

* Relevant educational background
* At least four years full-time practical work experience in information technology, of which at least two years in a role or function relating to information security
* Experience with one or more of the following standards: ISO 27001 and ISO 9001 and knowledge of best practices regarding information security.
* ISO 22301 - Business continuity and ISO 20000 - Service Management is not a requirement but is an advantage.
* Good communication and collaborative skills
* Must be able to travel, including overnight stays, often involving travel outside of normal working hours
* Good English skills in speech and writing, as well as fluent in Swedish, both in speech and writing
* Great commercial and sales skills preferred
* Strong communication and training skills preferred.


**Personal qualities**
* Are organized, service-minded, and focused on timely delivery with the right quality
* Are both a team player as well as self-reliant
* Like working in an international organization
* Are business- and customer-oriented
* Good communication and commercial skills, able to choose appropriate methods and style to suit the situation and audience.


 For more details about this role please contact: Patrik Flink, Operations Manager, Sweden at +46 708 301 683
   

  

 Please submit your CV in English or Swedish.
   

  

 Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Please be informed you may be requested to provide DNV with additional documents for a background check.

title: Solutions Consultant, Stockholm
description:
We are looking for a new Solutions Consulting team member in Stockholm to help accelerate our exciting journey ahead! As a member of this team, you will have the opportunity to become a trusted advisor and help world-class marketers gather, analyze, and optimize their data with Funnel.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Your main responsibilities include working as a sales engineer to demonstrate the value of Funnel to prospects and customers. This includes supporting them during their assessment period from a technical standpoint while sharing best practices related to gathering/managing/analyzing marketing data, especially within the context of addressing complex use cases.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with our Account Executives and Customer Success Managers as well as our Product teams to provide input on the evolution of the Funnel product.
   

  

 You will have achieved success when the prospect or customer fully understands how Funnel is foundational to helping them achieve their business goals as well as helping ongoing customers grow their business with Funnel.
   

  

**As a Solutions Consultant You Will**
* Lead technical pre-sales conversations with prospects
* Lead the implementation of Funnel as a first milestone of the Funnel journey
* Work with customers on complex marketing data use cases
* Become an expert in using the Funnel platform
* Provide input to the Product teams to make our solution even better and deliver ever-increasing value to our customers.
* Collaborate with other members of the global Solutions Consulting team on global initiatives.
* Support technical knowledge acquisition as needed by other teams including Customer Success, Support, etc.
* You will join the EMEA team with colleagues based in Stockholm, Dublin and London.


 If you'd like to learn more about Corinna, the Manager of the Solutions Consulting team in EMEA, and her views on leadership, check out this blog post.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a solutions-oriented, proactive product and customer evangelist with outstanding communication skills.
   

  

 You are curious, eager to learn, a team player, and seek out opportunities to help others.
   

  

 You thrive in a consultative environment where you feel comfortable being an expert and knowing how to guide, educate, and manage clear expectations of customers.
   

  

 You are detail-oriented and enjoy working with data. Going down the rabbit hole to get a deep understanding of a problem and how to solve it is something that appeals greatly to you!
   

  

**Experience & Skills**
* Around 2-4 years of experience in a solution/technical consulting or pre-sales engineering role
* Domain knowledge of digital platforms and/or experience in working with data, marketing analytics, or performance reporting
* Experience in and enjoy working in a client-facing role
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, Looker Studio or similar applications
* Fluency in spoken and written English
* Fluency in German is a plus


**Who We Are**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting. Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

**Other Information**
 This role is located in Stockholm. We value in-person collaboration, and as such, we work office-first, with some flexibility. We do not support relocation at the moment and therefore we will take into consideration only applicants with valid work permits or appropriate citizenship.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Business Operations Associate
description:
Are you passionate about delivering exceptional customer experience to entrepreneurs? We are hiring for a committed
 **Business Operations Associate** 
 to join our dynamic team!
   

  

**About Froda**
 Froda was founded in 2015 with a clear mission – to democratize the access to financing and provide small businesses the same opportunities to grow as large ones. Through digital processes and technological innovation, we have shortened the loan process from months to minutes, making it easy for business owners to invest in their ideas.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role, you will be the first point of contact for our customers, essential in providing high-quality support and contributing to their overall satisfaction. Your talent for understanding customer needs, coupled with your problem-solving skills, will not only resolve their issues but also enrich their experience with Froda.
   

  

**You will**
* Deliver exceptional customer service via email, and phone.
* Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve customer issues efficiently.
* Provide product and service information, highlighting features beneficial to customers.
* Collaborate with other teams to ensure a consistent and high-quality customer experience.
* Collect and report customer feedback to aid in enhancing our services.


**Who You Are**
* You possess excellent communication skills in both English and Swedish.
* Experience in customer service, support, or a similar role is preferred.
* You have an empathetic approach to handling customer queries and complaints.
* Able to multitask and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.
* You are tech-savvy and comfortable navigating customer support platforms and tools.


**What’s in it for you?**
 Working at Froda is everything you can expect from working at a tech scale: fun and fast-paced. We are 90+ ambitious people who work together mostly at the office, with few scheduled meetings. The culture is friendly, with a get-shit-done attitude. At Froda, you will truly have freedom under responsibility. This means that you will have the ability to impact your own work and tackle a wider set of tasks.
   

  

 Furthermore, you’ll get:
   

  

* Fun & exciting work environment in a fast-growing and profitable scale-up
* Competitive compensation package
* Insurance and pension plan
* The possibility to work in our awesome office in Stockholm
* Friendly culture that values work/life balance
* Monthly after-works that are actually fun


 If you're passionate about delivering unparalleled customer service and want to be part of our mission to redefine the banking experience for entrepreneurs, apply to join us as a Business Operations Associate today!

title: Domain Consultant Security Operations Transformation (Cortex)
description:
**Our Mission**
 At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
   

  

 Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
   

  

 Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 We take our mission of protecting the digital way of life seriously. We are relentless in protecting our customers and we believe that the unique ideas of every member of our team contributes to our collective success. Our values were crowdsourced by employees and are brought to life through each of us everyday - from disruptive innovation and collaboration, to execution. From showing up for each other with integrity to creating an environment where we all feel included.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you will be shaping the future of cybersecurity. We work fast, value ongoing learning, and we respect each employee as a unique individual. Knowing we all have different needs, our development and personal wellbeing programs are designed to give you choice in how you are supported. This includes our FLEXBenefits wellbeing spending account with over 1,000 eligible items selected by employees, our mental and financial health resources, and our personalized learning opportunities - just to name a few!
   

  

**Job Description**
**Your Career**
 As a Domain Consultant for SOC Transformation you will be the expert for our Cortex portfolio, a Next-Gen AI-powered security operations platform. You will play a key role in defining technical solutions that secure a customer’s key business imperatives. You evangelize our industry leading solutions in Security Intelligence and Automation, XDR, Attack Surface Management, SOAR and Incident Response that establish Palo Alto Networks as a customer’s cybersecurity partner of choice.
   

  

**Your Impact**
* Collaborate with account teams to recommend and develop customer solutions within your assigned specialization area
* Present to customers as our expert at all levels in the customer hierarchy, from practitioner to senior leadership
* Lead and support customer demonstrations that showcase our unique value proposition
* Scope and Lead Proof of Value (PoV) projects for prospective customers based on best practices to ensure technical win in your assigned opportunities
* Drive high technical validation and PoV win rates within your assigned specialization area
* Architect solutions that will help our customers strengthen and simplify their security posture
* Accelerate technical validation of proposed solutions within your specialization
* Document High-Level Design and Key Use Cases to ensure proper implementation and value realization of Palo Alto Networks Solutions
* Help our customers build and develop further their services around Cortex solutions
* Lead conversations about industry trends and emerging changes to the security landscape
* Discuss, with credibility, competitive offers in the marketplace and position ours as the best alternative
* Assist account solutions consultants to respond effectively to RFIs/RFPs while serving as the main technical point of contact for Cortex
* Position Palo Alto Networks or Partner delivered services as appropriate to ensure proper implementation and value realization of Palo Alto Networks solutions


**Qualifications**
**Your Experience**
* 3+ years experience in Security Operations or pre-sales/sales engineering within SIEM, SOAR, SOC, and/or endpoint environments
* Experience in working with customers, demonstrating problem-solving skills and a can-do attitude
* Solid understanding of Security Operations Center processes
* Advanced knowledge of SIEM and/or SOAR solutions
* Scripting experience is a plus - Python preferred
* Proficient in English and Swedish


**Additional Information**
**The Team**
 Our Domain Consultant team members work hand-in-hand with organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire,and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.
   

  

 You are empowered with unmatched systems and tools and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. Our Solutions Consulting community is driven by the mission to be our customers’ cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting their digital way of life.
   

  

**Our Commitment**
 We’re problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
   

  

 We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
