title: Regional Workplace Manager
description:
**Job Description**
**Role background**
 Responsible for the Workplace Experience and Operations for a region, our Workplace Managers combine People, Technology, and Space across Office and Serviced Office locations to create an exceptional workplace experience for our Employees, Visitors, Contractors and Courier Partners. Regional Workplace Managers support their direct reports (in country workplace managers) to perform at their best, providing guidance and oversight to ensure our workplaces’ functionality, comfort, safety, sustainability and efficiency; whilst ensuring that our office ‘hubs’ are properly set up for collaboration and focus as well as our smaller satellite locations without onsite staff appropriately situated, supported and well-equipped.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Lead a regional team of Workplace Managers, Workplace Coordinators in ensuring our workplace experience supports Wolt’s mission & values and team objectives are met.
* Setup and onboard new offices as Wolt expands in your region. Partner with business leads, local and global teams to ensure effective communication with landlords, internal and external stakeholders so that office projects in your region can be delivered on time and in accordance with both Wolt’s global standards and any local requirements.
* Ensure all sites within the regional portfolio are managed and maintained to a high standard and in compliance with local and global policies and guidelines.
* Build department policies and procedures in conjunction with Wolt’s Global Facilities and Operations manager, complying with International Health and Safety Standards.
* Partner with central teams such as Physical Security and Safety, Sustainability and People to provide office specific program roll outs for initiatives such as Health and Safety, Sustainability and DEI, Internal Events and Community.
* Partner with Integrated Facilities Management Vendors to ensure safe and compliant workspaces and that service level agreements are met. Conduct formal site condition inspections and work closely with responsible parties to ensure any deficiencies identified are resolved.
* Create and own the development of annual Opex budgets for your region, tracking and reporting on financial variance and operations expenses management.


**Our humble expectations**
**What we look for**
* 4+ years previous experience in Workplace or Facilities Management in a global organization within a fast-paced and high growth environment
* Bachelors or equivalent years of experience
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
* Strong leadership capabilities, proven experience to motivate and lead a team
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to work with internal and external stakeholders
* A demonstrated ability to work collaboratively across departments and levels within a complex organization.
* Ability and willingness to travel in order to properly support all locations in-Region (especially during office relocations and openings)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.Ability to work autonomously in a fast-moving environment, strong relationship building and stakeholder management skills, and a true growth mindset to consistently learn and develop skills.
* Comfortable collaborating remotely and dynamically using digital tools such as GSuite, Slack and Zoom.


**Next Steps**
 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!
   

  

 We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so if this sounds like an opportunity you want to pursue, apply today!
   

  

 If you have any further questions about the position before submitting an application, you can turn to: Linn Lima, Talent Acquisition Partner:
   

  

 linn.lima@external.wolt.com
   

  

 Please note that we do not accept applications coming in via email. Please submit your application in English via our job portal.
   

  

**About Wolt**
**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to home or to the office. Our local commerce platform makes it easy for customers to order whatever they need on one app, for merchants to make additional sales, and for couriers to make meaningful earnings flexibly. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local commerce platforms to retail software and financial solutions, as well as operates its own grocery stores under the brand Wolt Market. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. Today DoorDash operates in 29 countries around the globe, 23 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

**So, why work at Wolt?**
 At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way. Join us today to build Wolt together.

title: Experienced Consultant - Service Operations
job_function: Consulting, Customer Service, and Project Management
company_industry: Banking, Insurance, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Who You'll Work With**
 You will be based in one of our European offices as part of our Operations Practice.
   

  

 Our Operations Practice assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges. Blending strategic thinking with hands-on practicality, our teams of consultants and experts work to develop and implement operational strategies that solve our clients’ most pressing problems.
   

  

 McKinsey’s Service Operations service line is part of our Operations Practice. It helps clients create and execute service strategies that lead to competitive advantage, an improved customer experience, higher effectiveness and quality of work, and measurable bottom-line impact.
   

  

 The service areas we work in range from end-customer services (e.g., call centers and field services) to internal back-office operations (e.g., in IT, HR, and Finance). In each of these areas, we help our clients enhance their productivity and set them up for the future, which, in many cases, leads to the longer-term transformation of the operating model (including structures, processes, technology, and people).
   

  

 When you join McKinsey as a Consultant, you join a firm that will challenge you and invest heavily in your professional development. You will have the opportunity to work in dynamic teams and help leading global organizations solve some of their most challenging and complex problems.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 You will play an active role in problem-solving for clients, including identifying issues, forming hypotheses, designing and conducting analyses, and synthesizing conclusions into recommendations.
   

  

 You will shape the clients’ digital agendas, create the next generation of operational models, and digitally transform end-to-end journeys using advanced analytics, robotics, and agile methodologies in service-oriented industries. Additionally, you will assist our client teams in developing strategies and technology roadmaps for implementing processes and operating systems that support applications connected to digital service operations.
   

  

 You will also gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. You will receive exceptional training, frequent coaching, and ongoing mentoring from colleagues and senior leaders on your teams.
   

  

*Your application should be in English and include your CV and your transcripts (high school, university, etc.), indicating all relevant grades.*
 OPS2024
   

  

**Qualifications**
* A master’s degree and exceptional academic performance.
* Broad experience in modern technologies (digital solutions) and robotics, preferably in the banking, insurance, or software industry or from specialized consultancies (e.g., digital Service Operations, end-to-end process digitalization, lean/Six Sigma, and zero-based budgeting).
* A proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities.
* Mobility and enthusiasm for taking on European assignments during the work week.
* Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills.
* The ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and the local office language.

title: IT-Arkitekt & specialist inom säkerhet
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Är du IT-Arkitekt & specialist inom säkerhet? Trivs du när du får jobba i en social roll med många kontaktytor? Har du arbetat som konsult eller i en linjebefattning och är ute efter nästa steg i din karriär?
   

  

**Då är det dig vi söker!**
 Drivs du likt oss av att ligga i digitaliseringens framkant? Vill du dessutom använda denna drivkraft i en konsultroll och hjälpa våra kunder att bättre ta tillvara på digitaliseringens möjligheter?
   

  

 I rollen har du kunden i fokus och driver dem framåt i uppdrag som förstudier, utredningar, strategiformuleringar och implementationsprojekt. Du agerar i många olika roller som t.ex. verksamhetsanalytiker, arkitekt och projektledare, alltid med ett rådgivande förhållningssätt.
   

  

 CGI är en global IT leverantör som levererar högkvalitativ affärsrådgivning, systemintegration och outsourcing tjänster. Vi arbetar sida vid sida med kunder för att omvandla innovation, data och teknik till framgång för dem.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en del av CGI Public där vi jobbar tätt tillsammans för många olika kunder i en föränderlig miljö. Vi söker dig som vill vara med och göra skillnad för våra kunder, där du får jobba med spännande uppdrag och vara med och på en strategisk och operativ nivå.
   

  

 Tillsammans med ett gäng fantastiska medarbetare och ledare kan vi erbjuda dig ett roligt och stimulerande arbete. Vi har en generös företagskultur och delar med oss av vår kunskap, vilket också är en förutsättning för att vi tillsammans ska lyckas med att utveckla vår verksamhet.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som IT-Arkitekt & specialist inom säkerhet hos oss kommer du att vara en nyckelperson som bidrar till att driva och ta fram efterfrågat material för att därefter kunna ta viktiga beslut inom både arkitektur och teknik samt lösningsförslag till våra kunder.
   

  

 Rollen kan innefatta att ansvara för säkerhetsutredningar och göra analyser samt agera på ”onormala” händelser genom att göra säkerhetsbedömningar. Du kommer även att arbeta med säkerhetsincidenter genom att skapa rekomendationer till ökad säkerhet i kundernas IT-miljöer. Även att leda workshops samt möta kunder för att ta fram olika förslag på lösning och tidsestimat utifrån kunders behov kommer ingå.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen som söker vi dig som är problemlösare, ansvarstagande, flexibel och relationsskapande med ett brinnande intresse för IT-säkerhet och nätverk. Du trivs med att jobba både i grupp och självständigt.
   

  

 Du kan flytande svenska, både i tal och skrift, då våra kunder primärt finns inom den publika sektorn samt behärskar engelska som är CGIs koncernspråk samt har en akademisk examen som högskoleingenjör eller motsvarande civil-/master examen inom exempelvis IT-säkerhet, data IT eller nätverk, alternativt relevant erfarenhet från liknande roll.
   

  

**På grund av tjänstens karaktär kräver att du har svenskt medborgarskap då du arbetar med säkerhetsklassificerad information och samhällskritiska system.**
 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

* Vara väl insatt i tekniska standarder, tekniker och produkter.
* Goda kunskaper inom design av IT-infrastruktur, nätverk, applikationsdrift och Operativsystem (UNIX, Linux samt Windows) samt överföringsprotokoll som tex TCP/IP.
* Erfarenhet av Identitetshantering samt sårbarhetshantering.
* Stark social och kommunikationsförmåga med fokus på att skapa goda relationer
* Stark analytisk förmåga för att enkelt sätta sig in i och förstå komplexa miljöer och kontexter samt hur komponenter är relaterade till varandra
* Uttrycker sig tydligt i skrift och tal både på Svenska och Engelska; förmåga att skriva tydliga och koncisa säkerhetsdokument
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av systemutveckling och/eller projektledning


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Business Analyst
description:
*Vill du jobba i branschens roligaste och mest kompetenta team, med att säkerställa Länsförsäkringars resa mot datadriven och högpresterande rapportering? Länsförsäkringar* 
*har höga ambitioner och befinner sig i en spännande fas i vår digitala transformation. Hos oss kommer du att få lära dig mycket och påverka resan. Låter det som något för dig? Då är du den vi söker!*
**Om jobbet**
 I rollen som Business Analyst hos Länsförsäkringar AB får du chansen att arbeta med många kontaktytor inom organisationen. Din huvudsakliga uppgift kommer att vara att översätta verksamhetens önskemål, krav och idéer till implementerbara lösningar
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden inkluderar:
   

  

* Fungera som en brygga mellan intressenter, användare och IT-avdelningen, och säkerställa effektiv kommunikation och samarbete.
* Utföra detaljerad kravanalys, dokumentera processer och genomföra testning för att säkerställa att lösningarna uppfyller verksamhetens behov.
* Förtydliga krav och dela upp dem i funktionella och icke-funktionella kategorier, samt aktivt driva och delta i diskussioner kring design och implementation för att säkerställa att lösningarna är både effektiva och hållbara.


 Du kommer att arbeta nära vårt leveransteam och rapportera till verksamhetens produktägare. En viktig del av ditt arbete blir att aktivt driva förändrings- och anpassningsarbete för att framtidssäkra vår rapporteringsförmåga både på kort och lång sikt, samt att säkerställa en hög datakvalitet.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du:
   

  

* Minst fem års dokumenterad erfarenhet som verksamhets- och kravanalytiker, business analyst, produktägare eller motsvarande.
* Har erfarenhet av grundläggande SQL och databaskunskap samt vara bekant med SAFe (eller andra agila ramverk) och agil kravmetodik
* Har en relevant akademisk examen och Du kan uttrycka dig väl på både svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


 Det är meriterande om:
   

  

* du har arbetat med liknande frågor i bankmiljö alternativt större transaktionsintensiva organisationer samt om du har arbetat med anpassning av affärssystem/ERP-system.


 Som person är du metodisk, noggrann och strävar efter hög kvalitet i dina leveranser. Du har en god förståelse för både IT och verksamheten och anpassar ditt arbetssätt efter specifika behov. Du är engagerad, lösningsfokuserad och prestigelös, och hjälper gärna till där det behövs. Du trivs med att samarbeta och kommunicera med kollegor tvärs kompetensområden i en agil och föränderlig miljö.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi erbjuder spännande utmaningar för rätt person att utvecklas, fördjupa sig och bidra till vår förändringsresa inom Ekonomi och Finans. Vårt mål är att framtidssäkra rapporteringsprocessen och driva utvecklingsprojekt inom Länsförsäkringar Bank för att säkerställa hög datakvalitet och automatisering.
   

  

 Gruppens uppdrag är brett och kompetensen hos kollegorna är hög, vilket ger dig utmärkta möjligheter till lärande och kompetensutveckling. Vi tror på att ha roligt tillsammans, eftersom det är då både du och gruppen presterar som bäst. För oss är balansen mellan arbete och fritid viktig, och Länsförsäkringar erbjuder många förmåner inom hälsa och välbefinnande.
   

  

 Gruppen Bankredovisning inom Ekonomi och Finans på Länsförsäkringar AB hanterar all redovisning och myndighetsrapportering för Länsförsäkringar Bank och dess dotterbolag. Rollen som Business Analyst innebär många kontaktytor inom banken och rapporterar direkt till chefen för Bankredovisning. Låter detta som något för dig?
   

  

 Då ser vi fram emot att välkomna dig till vårt team!
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-11-07**

title: KTH & SSE - Women in Consulting After Work
description:
**Aspiring female management consultants – We invite you to Cupole to talk about women in consulting!**
 At Cupole, we are committed to empowering women leaders and fostering gender diversity both within our firm and beyond. We warmly invite female students from KTH and SSE to an engaging After Work at our new office.
   

  

 If you're curious to learn what it's like to be a woman in management consulting, this is the perfect opportunity! Meet consultants from various seniority levels, discuss career paths, life in consulting, and everything in between—while enjoying drinks and light snacks in a relaxed setting.
   

  

 At Cupole, we value individuals with
 **great minds and big hearts** 
 – if that sounds like you, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

**When** 
 : Thursday, November 14th, 17:00-20:00
   

  

**Where** 
 : Grev Turegatan 1
   

  

**Application deadline** 
 : Thursday, November 7th
   

  

 Sign up now to secure your spot for an evening of inspiration, insights, and networking – we look forward to seeing you!
   

  

 This event is primarily aimed at year 2-4 at KTH and at SSE 2nd and 3rd-year bachelor’s as well as 1st-year master’s students at SSE, and is is exclusively for women as we recognize the importance of attracting talented women to Cupole.
   

  

 Kind regards,
   

  

**Cupole team**
 Cupole is a management consultancy firm, advising clients since 2010. Our goal is to deliver sophisticated and complex solutions, whilst also focusing on the client/consultant interaction. Great minds and big hearts. If we condensate it to a minimum, we deliver services within M&A, Strategy and Business Improvement.

title: Head of Asset Operations
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

 With an industry-leading AI-powered platform at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled Head of Asset Operations.
   

  

**👩‍💻 About The Role**
 As the Head of Asset Operations, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping and leading our Asset Operations function from the ground up. You will be responsible for building a high-performing team that will take ownership of the day-to-day operations of a growing renewable energy portfolio. In this role, you’ll work closely with the Asset Integration and Asset Control teams to ensure operational efficiency, manage incidents, and improve asset performance.
   

  

 You will also be responsible for setting up the foundation for a future 24/7 operations center, ensuring that our assets are continuously monitored and optimized.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Establish and recruit the Asset Operations team, focusing on operational excellence and efficient asset management.
* Set up a team structure that ensures clear ownership and accountability for asset performance and downtime management.
* Design and execute strategies for optimizing asset performance, minimizing downtime, and improving system reliability.
* Establish processes for handling asset incidents, from identification to resolution, ensuring transparency and timely response.
* Collaborate with the Asset Control and Asset Integration squads to ensure smooth operation and cross-team communication.
* Evaluate and improve existing tools and processes for monitoring and managing assets, including real-time tracking, alarms, and incident resolution workflows.
* Liaise with external stakeholders and partners, ensuring smooth handoffs and issue resolution.


**Who You Are**
* A reliable and available individual with strong leadership skills.
* Structured and process-driven, ensuring tasks are executed efficiently.
* Previous experience in operations and maintenance, ideally within renewable energy.
* Experienced in using software tools and comfortable working with modern solutions.


**📍 Location**
 Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from the old town and Slussen subway stations. We value office collaboration but support hybrid work.
   

  

**✉️ Apply**
 To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and what you think you could bring to our team. Throughout the recruitment process you will meet with the Talent Acquisition Specialist, VP of Asset Management and our CEO.
   

  

 Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: User Acquisition Specialist (Mobility)
description:
**Hey there!**
 This is Marie Feldborg, Marketing Director for Mobility, alongside Linda Csapo, Vertical Marketing Lead. Together, we’re driving growth in the Mobility sector, and we’re excited to be looking for a new colleague to join our team!
   

  

 As a User Acquisition Specialist at Schibsted Marketplaces (https://schibsted.com/about/), you will play a pivotal role within our Mobility Marketing Squad. You will be responsible for developing and executing strategies that convert traffic into active users by driving various types of conversions throughout the buyer and seller journeys in our Mobility categories, across our leading Nordic brands (Blocket, FINN, Bilbasen & DBA).
   

  

 In this role, you'll collaborate closely with the Mobility marketing team, as well as with product, tech, and analytics teams, to fuel growth and ensure the success of our user acquisition efforts.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop user acquisition and conversion strategies tailored to our mobility marketplace offerings and services across all our Nordic markets in Sweden, Denmark & Norway for tactical conversion driven marketing activities.
* Implement and execute the user acquisition and conversion strategies across the markets, by collaborating closely with local performance marketeers on campaign execution in the local markets.
* Manage and optimize multi-channel campaigns (social media, search engines, display advertising, etc.) to drive user growth within our Mobility categories, such as high quality traffic, leads on car ads, ad insertions in our Mobility categories, transactions for our mobility products and services etc.
* Analyze user data and mobility user journeys to identify opportunities for growth and improvements.
* Monitor and report on the performance of user acquisition and conversion initiatives, providing insights and recommendations.
* Conduct A/B testing to optimize campaign performance and user experience.
* Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in user acquisition and conversions strategies as well as general digital marketing.
* Collaborate with the rest of the Brands & marketing team to create compelling content and creatives for campaigns.


**Qualifications & Experiences**
* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in user acquisition, digital marketing, or growth hacking.
* Proven track record of managing successful user acquisition campaigns.
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in using data-driven insights to inform strategies.
* Experience with marketing tools and platforms such as Google Ads, Meta Ads, Amplitude, Braze, Tableau, Snowflake and other analytics software.
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
* Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.


**Personal Attributes**
* Data cruncher
* Team player
* Curious and experimental mindset
* Solution oriented with a can do-attitude


**Key Competence - What We Are Looking For**
* Fluent in Swedish speaking & writing (Native level)
* Someone that gets highly motivated by analyzing user data and identifying user trends to see what possibilities there are for conversion optimization in the Mobility user journeys, on and off our marketplaces, and with the ability to convert it into opportunities and activities for growth and improvement
* A very hands-on profile that can manage and optimize multi-channel performance initiatives to drive user growth and user engagement within our Mobility categories, such as high quality traffic, leads on car ads, ad insertions, transactions for our mobility products and services etc.
* High technical understanding of lead attribution with the ability to collaborate closely with product & tech teams, as well as relevant marketing colleagues with adjacent activities, channels and conversion goals


**Interested?**
 If this role and environment have caught your interest, we look forward to learning more about you soon! The last application date is the 8th of November, but we will be conducting interviews on a rolling basis. We eagerly await your application and look forward to hearing about your skills and career goals. We value diversity and encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply.
   

  

 You are welcome to get in touch with us if you have questions regarding the positions. Hiring Manager,
 **Marie Feldborg** 
 , Marketing Director for Mobility marie.felborg@schibsted.com or Talent Acquisition Partner Manisha Kathuria, manisha.kathuria@schibsted.com

title: Online Marketing Manager
description:
**What does this role entail?**
 As a
 **Online Marketing Manager** 
 at Pointsharp you are responsible for planning and executing all global Corporate Campaigns, as well as making sure they are successful.
   

  

 In this role you are a part of the
 **Marketing Department** 
 and report to the
 **Head of Marketing** 
 .
   

  

**Your Primary Duties Include, But Are Not Limited To**
* You develop and deliver quarterly, global Corporate Marketing plans that integrate sales and marketing requirements to support Thought Leadership, pipeline and revenue goals.
* Besides, you develop and execute a marketing channel strategy for website, social media and email.
* Furthermore, you develop and execute demand generation marketing programs taking into account input from Event-Marketing, Content-Marketing and Product-Marketing.
* Additionally, you forecast and measure the impact of the marketing programs on sales cycles while analyzing program results, optimizing as needed.
* You own the planning and execution of vertical-based marketing, including Account Based Marketing programs that penetrate global key accounts.
* Also, you maintain ongoing communications and be the go-to marketing resource for global sales leaders and partner marketing.


**You’ll thrive in this role if you**
* You already have 3+ years of professional experience in online marketing and have driven your own projects forward.
* Degree in business administration, marketing, communications or comparable qualification.
* You have in-depth knowledge of the core areas of digital marketing, including SEO, SEA, social media marketing, content marketing and email marketing.
* You have strong analytical skills and are primarily numbers and data driven.
* You have a deep technical understanding of websites and CRM.
* You have excellent communication skills set you apart.
* You work independently, proactively and in a structured manner.


**Why Pointsharp?**
 We believe it should be fun and pleasant to go to work, it should be a place where you meet and hang out with your friends and colleagues. This means that we invest a lot in joint activities and good benefits.
   

  

**You Are Offered**
* To be part of an innovative, and internationally growing company that is characterized by entrepreneurship and technology.
* A varied and exciting everyday work-life where no day is the same.
* A company that values community and corporate culture and put the employees in focus.
* Short decision paths and great opportunities to develop within your role and the company.


 During the last couple of years, we have grown exponentially and today we have offices in Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Switzerland and Denmark.
   

  

 We offer a varied and exciting everyday life at an international company that is just in the beginning of our growth journey. At Pointsharp, the employees are in focus and we put a lot of effort into safeguarding our community and culture, a culture that has long been characterized by entrepreneurship and a strong focus on technology. Something that contributes to short decision paths and great opportunities to develop within their role and the company. Your impact and knowledge will take us further.
   

  

 At Pointsharp you have potential to develop within your role and the company. Creativity is key for our future success and creativity comes if you have fun and inspiring environment.
   

  

**About Us**
 Pointsharp is a European cybersecurity company founded in 2006. Pointsharp delivers specialized software and services that help organizations secure identities, authorization, access, and data in a user-friendly way. We believe easy-to-use security solutions are the foundation for a safe, modern digital workplace.
   

  

 We offer a varied and exciting everyday life at an international company that is just at the beginning of our growth journey. At Pointsharp, the employees are in focus. We put a lot of effort into safeguarding our community and culture, a culture that has long been characterized by entrepreneurship and a strong focus on technology. Something that contributes to short decision paths and great opportunities to develop within their role and the company. At Pointsharp, all genders are welcome.
   

  

 Pointsharp — Security made easy
   

  

 https://www.pointsharp.com/

title: Customer Success Manager – Super iPaaS
description:
**Introduction**
 A Customer Success Manager Architect (CSM) career in IBM means a career where you're helping clients fully realise the value of their existing IBM products, whilst growing their adoption of next-generation technologies from across IBM's wider portfolio. It means being a trusted strategic advisor to some of the world's most transformational enterprises and culturally influential brands, as they rely on your expertise and our technology to solve some of their hardest problems.
   

  

 Excellent onboarding and an industry leading learning culture will set you up for positive impact and success, whilst ongoing development will advance your career through an upward trajectory. Our sales environment is collaborative and experiential. Part of a team, you'll be surrounded by bright minds and keen co-creators – always willing to help and be helped – as you apply passion to work that will have a positive impact to the world around us.
   

  

**Your Role and Responsibilities**
 A Customer Success Manager opportunity in IBM might be different to what you're used to. In addition to the people and commercial skills often associated with this position, an IBM CSM is also an Architect. Someone with a deep understanding of technical complexities. A person who can quickly understand clients' hard-to-understand technology issue and communicate them back in an easy-to-understand way.
   

  

 With deep roots in a hands-on technological background, and through different communication techniques, you'll be able to showcase IBM solutions. Using excellent communication, you'll articulate their compatibilities with a client's stack via use-case identification, solution architecture design, and MVP builds.
   

  

 With technical expertise and a consultative style, you'll quickly build credibility as a trusted advisor at all levels. To drive expansion and renewal growth, you'll guide IT executives through the changes needed to realise the full value of expanding their adoption of IBM's products.
   

  

**Your Primary Responsibilities Will Include**
* Understanding Client's Challenges and Building Trust: Understand clients' primary challenges and establish yourself as a trusted technical expert for their migration, deployment, and adoption of Hybrid Cloud and AI Growth offerings.
* Facilitating Use Case Exploration and Business Framing: Lead use case exploration and business framing workshops, develop client value realization models.
* Leading Persuasive Technical Conversations: Lead technical discussions that persuade clients to act based on their requirements and the value provided by IBM's solutions.
* Creating Post-Deployment Customer Success Plans: Develop post-deployment customer success plans aimed at continually increasing post-launch, active user adoption of IBM's products.


**Required Technical and Professional Expertise**
* Proven Technical Expertise in Complex Technology Sales: Demonstrated track record as a technical expert (e.g., Engineer or equivalent) in successfully closed Technology sales cycles.
* Hands-On Experience in Technology Domains: A previous background with hands-on practical experience in one of the following areas: Cloud, Data and AI, Automation, Integration or Security, enabling rapid establishment of credible trust with client stakeholders.
* Proficiency in Agile Practices: Solid experience in utilizing agile best practices to achieve successful outcomes in an agile and swift manner.
* Effective Communication and Relationship Building: Demonstrable success in communicating and personal relationship development at all levels, from engineers to CIOs.
* Self-Motivation and Problem-Solving Aptitude: A natural inclination toward self-motivation and initiative, in addition to the ability to navigate data and people to find answers and present solutions.
* Prior success in a customer-facing role such as customer success, consulting, pre-sales, technical account management, or equivalent functions
* Several years of professional experience with complex software and IT solutions (Cloud and SaaS solutions) or in supporting customers in an integration environment
* Track record of achieving targets and goals/quotas
* Ability to lead technical/in-depth conversations
* Handled difficult customer situations and escalations
* Willingness and ability to travel as required to spend time with customers
* Business fluent in English
* Experience with using or implementing webMethods (or a similarly mature product)


**Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise**
* Broad Technology Solution Expertise: Proven experience working with a diverse range of technology solutions, including Cloud, Data & AI, and more (training in IBM's products will be provided).
* Sales Experience in Software and Cloud: Demonstrated experience in software and Cloud sales, encompassing software, SaaS, IaaS, PaaS, and Cloud solutions.
* Ability to speak another language besides English (nice to have)


**About Business Unit**
 IBM has a global presence, operating in more than 175 countries with a broad-based geographic distribution of revenue. The company’s Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM’s global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients’ growth and innovation. By complementing local expertise with global experience and digital capabilities, IBM builds deep and broad-based client relationships. This local management focus fosters speed in supporting clients, addressing new markets and making investments in emerging opportunities. Additionally, the Global Markets organization serves clients with expertise in their industry as well as through the products and services that IBM and partners supply. IBM is also expanding its reach to new and existing clients through digital marketplaces.
   

  

**Your Life @ IBM**
 In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.
   

  

 Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.
   

  

 Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.
   

  

 Are you ready to be an IBMer?
   

  

**About IBM**
 IBM's greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.
   

  

 Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.
   

  

 At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.
   

  

**Location Statement**
 IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.
   

  

**Being You @ IBM**
 IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, caste, genetics, pregnancy, disability, neurodivergence, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Systemingenjörer marina ledningsstödsystem/marina kommunikationssystem
description:
**Vill du arbeta med utvecklingen av marina kommunikations- och ledningsstödssystem, vilket är de system som stödjer den militära ledningens beslutsfattande? Inspireras du av tekniskt komplexa och föränderliga projekt och trivs att jobba tillsammans med andra i team? Då kan du vara den vi söker.**
**Arbetsuppgifter**
 I rollen som ingenjör kommer du att stödja projektledare och projektmedlemmar. Du kommer arbeta i ett eller flera projekt och vara delaktig i allt från analys av kundbehov, kravställning, genomförande, överlämning och vidmakthållande.
   

  

 Enheten Marin C3 (Command, Control and Communications) söker just nu tre ingenjörer till våra pågående och planerade projekt. En del av vår verksamhet hanterar bl.a. utvecklingen av system för sjöövervakning och stödsystem för upprätthållande och rapportering av aktuell sjölägesinformation. En annan viktig del av vår verksamhet hanterar utveckling och vidmakthåll av bl.a. fast infrastruktur gällande marina kommunikationssystem, exempelvis inom radio och telekom.
   

  

 Som ingenjör på enheten Marin C3 deltar du i det tekniska systemarbetet genom att löpande tolka och formulera Försvarsmaktens behov av ökad eller utvecklad förmåga till tekniska krav. Du genomför tekniska granskningar, verifierar krav och tar fram förslag på utvecklade systemlösningar. Arbetet sker nära projektledare och andra kollegor på FMV i strävan efter att säkerställa att leveransen till Försvarsmakten sker i tid och till rätt kvalitet. Som ingenjör är du en betydelsefull resurs och medarbetare i både uppföljning och styrning av industrins arbete, hantering av driftärenden när Försvarsmakten behöver stöd och att följa den tekniska utvecklingen inom det tekniska området. I din roll kommer du i stor utsträckning jobba med exempelvis marinens sjöövervakning, landbaserade ledningsstödsystem, sensorer, taktiska länkar samt radio- och telekom.
   

  

 Tjänsterna är placerade i Stockholm. Tjänsteresor förekommer både inrikes och utrikes.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
 Du är civil- eller högskoleingenjör, alternativt har motsvarande relevant utbildning eller erfarenhet, som vi bedömer likvärdigt. Du har erfarenhet av projektarbete samt arbete som innebär att du har kontakt med leverantörer och kunder. Du har också erfarenhet av att arbeta med relevanta ledningsstödsystem, informationssystem och/eller kommunikationssystem.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Försvarsmaktens IT-system för telekomområdet med förståelse om dess koppling till nätverks och radiosystem och/eller informationssystem. Även kunskap och tidigare erfarenhet inom radiokommunikation och antenner inom exempelvis kortvåg, telefoni och IP nätverk är meriterande. Har du erfarenhet gällande utveckling och projektering avseende infrastruktur för telekommunikation och nätuppbyggnad, kommer du ha stor nytta av detta.
   

  

 För en av tjänsterna kommer fokusområdet vara att jobba med marinens landbaserade infrastruktur inom radio- och telekom. Det är därför starkt meriterande med erfarenhet eller kunskap inom sändar- och antennteknik samt vågutbredning för radio.
   

  

 FMV:s projektorienterade arbetssätt förutsätter att du trivs med att jobba tillsammans med andra i team. Arbetet kräver ett gott samarbete på såväl olika nivåer inom FMV som med andra verksamheter och organisationer, vilket kräver god samarbetsförmåga. Du har förmågan att anpassa dig efter nya omständigheter i ditt arbete och som person är du initiativtagande och tar ansvar för dina uppgifter samtidigt som du visar gott omdöme vid prioriteringar och avvägningar i ditt arbete. Då du kommer delta i arbetsmöten tillsammans med industrin och Försvarsmakten är det en förutsättning att du har en god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift, såväl på svenska som på engelska.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Om oss**
 FMV:s verksamhetsområde Ledningssystemmateriel ansvarar för att utveckla, upphandla och vidareutveckla materiel och tjänster inom ledningssystemområdet till Försvarsmakten, till exempel mobila kommunikationssystem, försvarets telenät samt operativa och taktiska informationssystem. Enheten Marin C3 ansvarar för materielområden som exempelvis ledningsstödsystem för marinens sjöövervakning av Sveriges territorialvatten.
   

  

**FMV – Försvarets materielverk**
 På FMV är du med och bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare. Vi upphandlar, utvecklar och levererar materiel och tjänster till det svenska försvaret. I vår vision ”Rätt materiel för ett starkare försvar” ryms vårt arbete och våra leveranser till Försvarsmakten av allt från helikoptrar, ubåtar, stridsflygplan och snörade kängor till kompasser, radarstationer, pansarterrängbilar och kuddar. Bredden i vårt uppdrag ger dig möjligheten att jobba med spännande innehåll, människor och projekt.
   

  

 På FMV jobbar vi aktivt utifrån utvecklande medarbetarskap, som är en modell för att utveckla samarbete, främja ansvarstagande och skapa engagemang för att ta tillvara på den initiativförmåga som vi alla besitter. Vi sätter värde på ömsesidigt förtroende och på ett hållbart arbetsliv. Därför erbjuder vi alla våra anställda ett brett utbud av utbildningar, kompetensutveckling och träning.
   

  

**Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens försvar?**
 Sök tjänsten via FMV:s webbplats. Vi vill ha dina ansökningshandlingar på svenska. Våra fackliga företrädare är SEKO Peter Andersson, SACO Kari Lehto, OFR/O Arne Molander och OFR/S Pia Edström. Alla nås på telefon 08-782 40 00 (FMV Växel).
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten ber vi dig kontakta rekryterande chef Johan Godin via 08-782 40 00. Har du frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kan du höra av dig till rekryterare Hanna Bonli via 0736 84 77 73.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-11-02.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan.**
 FMV finns för landet, i många delar av landet. Som medarbetare hos oss får du både en trygg och utmanande anställning och ett stort eget ansvar. För att jobba hos oss behöver du vara svensk medborgare och genomgå en säkerhetsprövning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar provanställning och som anställd kommer du att krigsplaceras utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via FMV:s webbplats eller via vår registratur. Vi har redan gjort vårt medieval, därför undanber vi oss samtal från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Credit Product Specialist
description:
**About The Role**
**Grade Level (for internal use):**
 11
   

  

**Credit Product Specialist - Europe**
**The Team**
 This is an exciting opportunity to join the Credit and Risk Solutions commercial Team, a focused and dynamic team with the opportunity to build on the last few years of significant growth and product development within the C&RS Business. The Credit Product Specialists’ mandate is to help Sales Specialists monetize and leverage SPGMI’s capabilities, by providing significant knowledge of credit capabilities including our quantitative market signal models and quantitative fundamentals-based models (PDs and LGDs), as well as qualitative credit assessment scorecards, research, and data, to serve our clients in managing complex credit risk management issues.
   

  

**The Impact**
 The C&RS business is a significant contributor to the overall growth of the Market Intelligence (MI) Division. The product suite is a critical piece of this growth story as the distribution channel for Ratings proprietary content and a provider of models and workflow tools to underpin the Credit Workflow for rated and unrated borrowers, counterparties, customers, and suppliers. The role of the Credit Product Specialist is critical to the success of the business. In an increasingly complex and competitive environment, credit products cannot be sold without the expertise of the Credit Product Specialist. These Specialists provide expertise and credibility to the sales and retention process. The role is therefore impactful and highly visible and, although heavily client-facing, is also beholden to many internal stakeholders.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
* Ability to specialize and work as an expert in credit and credit-related matters with a global market leader
* Be part of a high-performing team containing respected subject matter experts that one can work with, learn from, develop, and excel
* Daily exposure to external C-suite management, credit policy makers and credit market leaders
* Scope of the role allows for cross-functional and cross-regional flex
* High intellectual stimulation and strong future career prospects


**Responsibilities**
* Establishes relationships with Sales Specialists and Product Managers to help in diagnosing, distilling, designing and delivering credit workflow solutions specifically to the European market
* Aligns with Commercial and Product strategy for credit products and executes high level pre-sales and post-sales implementation plans
* Serves as a credit product matter expert across functional groups
* Demonstrates excellence across SPGMI credit capabilities
* Helping clients establish robust frameworks for integrating ESG factors into their Credit Assessment frameworks and understanding the potential impact of ESG on their credit portfolios
* Develops campaigns and initiatives for driving revenue growth for segment-specific sales and assists in client retention work around credit products
* Stays well connected to strategic credit customers in the market
* Collaborates internally to help design and deliver credit training on appropriate products
* Undertakes thought-leadership pieces, speakerships at relevant conferences and SPGMI credit webinars
* Possesses keen awareness of competitors and relative strengths
* Conducts Proof of Concepts, assists in RFPs and test cases for regulatory requirements such as IFRS9


**What We’re Looking For**
* Strong grasp of credit risk management
* In-depth understanding of complex client credit risk workflows ideally across multiple segments (Corporates, Commercial and Investment Banking, Insurance, and Investment Management)
* Ability to interact confidently with the team, prospects and clients as well as cross-functional teams within the organization, i.e. Product Management, Education, Legal and Marketing
* Ability to solve complex problems and, when necessary, adopt a new perspective using expert judgement
* Possession of exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
* Self-motivated, with a strong desire to succeed and a positive outlook
* Ability to work well under pressure and to multi-task
* 5+ years relevant industry experience in credit and risk management
* Someone strong in Excel and has credit modelling capabilities


**About S&P Global Market Intelligence**
 At S&P Global Market Intelligence, a division of S&P Global we understand the importance of accurate, deep and insightful information. Our team of experts delivers unrivaled insights and leading data and technology solutions, partnering with customers to expand their perspective, operate with confidence, and make decisions with conviction.
   

  

 For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Our Purpose**
 Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology–the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world.
   

  

 Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence®, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress.
   

  

**Our People**
 We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.
   

  

 From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We’re constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.
   

  

**Our Values**
**Integrity, Discovery, Partnership**
 At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of
 **integrity** 
 in all we do, bring a spirit of
 **discovery** 
 to our work, and collaborate in close
 **partnership** 
 with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion At S&P Global**
 At S&P Global, we believe diversity fuels creative insights, equity unlocks opportunity, and inclusion drives growth and innovation – Powering Global Markets. Our commitment centers on our global workforce, ensuring that our people are empowered to bring their whole selves to work. It doesn’t stop there, we strive to better reflect and serve the communities in which we live and work, and advocate for greater opportunity for all.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

title: Senior Research Scientist
description:
At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through fast, accurate diagnostic testing. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop scalable, groundbreaking solutions to solve the world’s most complex health challenges. Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics, from ideation to development and delivery of testing advancements that improve patient outcomes across a range of settings. As a member of our team, you can make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development.
   

  

 Cepheid is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Danaher Diagnostics companies. Together, we’re working at the pace of change on diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges, driven by knowing that behind every test there is a patient waiting.
   

  

 Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.
   

  

*The Senior Research Scientist is responsible for developing and validating molecular testing for Cepheid products, ensuring their accuracy and reliability. This includes designing experiments, analyzing data, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. The ideal candidate will have experience in product commercialization, and expert knowledge of molecular techniques (such as nucleic acid extraction and real time PCR). As a member of the R&D team you will contribute with your knowledge and skills to junior team members and other functions within the organization. Furthermore, you have a good ability to analyze technical data and review/write texts and reports. You find it easy to collaborate and are keen to achieve results in your work.*
 This position is part of the Assay R&D team and will be in Solna, Sweden. At Cepheid, our vision is to be the leading provider of seamlessly connected diagnostic solutions.
   

  

**In this role, you will have the opportunity to:**
* Evaluate, test, and optimize real time PCR and RT-PCR assay procedures and assay prototypes based on design of experiments and design input requirements.
* Apply sophisticated analytical problem-solving skills to reagent and system integration issues to identify critical performance factors for assay development
* Design, plan and execute experiments to meet project and company objectives
* Work both independently and in a team environment
* Analyze data using statistical tools such as Microsoft Excel, Minitab or JMP
* Communicate data in different forums on a regular basis
* Work in a BSL3 environment


 The role also includes participating in project planning, decision-making and problem solving.
   

  

 Cepheid offers a dynamic and fast-paced role in a company with products that save lives. You will join a team with competent people who have fun together.
   

  

**The essential requirements of the job include:**
* BSc or MSc in relevant scientific discipline (e.g., Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Cell Biology) with 5+ years of related work experience within medical device (preferred), biotech, or pharmaceutical
* Must have strong background in molecular biology methods such as PCR and real-time PCR, experimental design, data analysis and statistical techniques
* Experience of working in a regulated business (ISO and/or GMP)
* Strong oral and written communication skills
* Good ability to structure, organize and prioritize lab work and to maintain detailed experimental records
* Thorough understanding and adherence to biosafety protocols and guidelines, ensuring a safe and compliant laboratory environment for handling biological materials and hazardous substances


**It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:**
* Experience in the development of medical technology and/or pharmaceutical products (knowledge of US and/or CE-IVD medical technology regulations)
* Proficiency in assay optimization and validation: Understanding how to optimize and validate assays for accuracy, sensitivity, and specificity


 Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.
   

  

 For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
   

  

 At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

title: SAP Solution Architect
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 Vattenfall erkänns som en av pionjärerna i energiomställningen och genom det möjliggör vi klimatsmartare liv för alla våra kunder.
   

  

 Vår investeringskraft, vår innovation och vår ambitiösa agenda att bli fossilfria på en generation kan dock bara uppnås om vi kan lita på en pålitlig och konkurrenskraftig produktion från våra kärnkraftverk. För att möta denna utmaning investerar vi i våra medarbetare och fortsätter att anställa exceptionella IT-talanger. Tillsammans med vårt team driver vi fram Vattenfall Nuclear för att bli ett datadrivet företag, vilket gör det möjligt för dem att optimera beslutsfattande och investeringsplanering.
   

  

 Detta innebär att vi designar
   

  

* Vårt företags resursplanering och logistik lösningar på SAP S/4HANA
* En integrerad och hybrid SAP- och omgivande systemmiljö bestående av flera instanser (moln och lokalt)
* Lösningar som är avgörande för den svenska infrastrukturen och samhället och som regleras enligt Säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585)
* Fullständig IT/OT-samverkan för att säkerställa friktionsfri överföring av data i (nära) realtid för att främja användningsfall för prediktivt underhåll
* IT-infrastruktur och lösningar som har hög säkerhet, skalbarhet och tillförlitlighet
* Strategiska lösningar/miljöer för att optimera underhållsstrategier för kärnkraft


 Vårt team behöver duktiga lösningsarkitekter med verksamheten i fokus; Du vet hur man använder teknologi för att få kärnkraften att fungera som en klocka, du agerar som en tidtagare för att säkerställa att vi når våra ambitiösa mål och vara en varningsklocka om vi kan göra det ännu bättre! Vi har en omfattande SAP- och Microsoft-närvaro, med över 20 000 användare i sex länder.
   

  

 Vårt Group IT Architecture-team, består av 30 Enterprise-/lösningsarkitekter, som är involverade i cirka 100+ nyckelprojekt samtidigt och fokuserar på företagsarkitektur och lösningsarkitektur för alla Vattenfalls affärsenheter. Vi agerar som navet för att förstå affärsbehoven och för att se den större bilden för Vattenfall och hjälpa våra team att säkert anta morgondagens teknologier.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:
   

  

* Du kommer att delta i större strategiska projekt för att vägleda dem till framgångsrik genomförande baserat på lämplig arkitektur.
* Du kommer att ge rådgivning och utbilda kärnkraftsverksamheten om SAP, IT-strategi, integrationsstrategi, datastrategi och SAP-strategi, etc.
* Du har en gedigen förståelse för IT-säkerhet och kommer att stödja kärnkraftverken i lämplig anpassningar.
* Du kommer att ha (eller bygga upp) kunskap inom kärnkraften och SAP för att bli den främsta kontaktpersonen för att främja deras resa med S/4.
* Du kommer att hjälpa oss att utveckla vårt Enterprise tänkande och etablera standarder och arkitekturprinciper.


 Du kommer att vara vår betrodda rådgivare gentemot våra kärnkraftverk och andra affärsområden för att möjliggöra deras driftsmodell genom teknologi - även om det innebär radikal förändring!
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

 Vår idealiska kandidat:
   

  

 Vi letar efter en erfaren lösningsarkitekt med praktisk erfarenhet av SAP-lösningsarkitektur, företrädesvis (i tidigare uppdrag) som SAP-arkitekt inom vatten- eller energiförsörjning, tillverkning eller fordonsindustrin.
   

  

 Du känner dig bekväm med att kommunicera med både IT- och icke-IT-kollegor på olika nivåer i organisationen. Du trivs i en ständigt föränderlig miljö. Dessutom har du:
   

  

* En akademisk examen inom IT eller relaterat område
* Du talar svenska och engelska
* Erfarenhet av Enterprisearkitektur och ramverk i en internationell miljö
* Du har djupgående teknisk kunskap inom SAP och allmän IT-kunskap
* Du har arbetat inom en kapitalintensiv bransch och förstår säkerhetsaspekter, IEC 62443, ISO27001, osv.
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure Well Architected Framework
* Förmåga att producera arkitekturdokument som är redo för företagsbruk och att omsätta komplexa problem till koncisa åtgärder för en styrelsen.
* Och vi älskar arkitekter som pratar affärsverksamhet och känner till TOGAF, snarare än de som pratar TOGAF och kan affärsverksamhet...


 Plats: För denna tjänst förväntas du vara baserad i Sverige med vilja att resa regelbundet till kontoret (Stockholm, Solna). Ibland kan det också bli resor till viktiga kärnkraftsplatser, som Ringhals, Forsmark, Oskarshamn eller teammöten i Amsterdam och Berlin. Du förväntas resa ungefär en gång i månaden under två dagar till dessa platser.
   

  

 Vårt erbjudande:
   

  

* Bli en del av ett massivt transformationsuppdrag - inte bara på papperet, utan i verkligheten - där du kan påverka resultatet!
* Vi erbjuder en utmanande och internationell arbetsmiljö och möjligheten att arbeta med några av de bästa inom området.
* Du kommer att arbeta i ett tvärvetenskapligt team med andra erfarna IT-arkitekter - vi gör detta tillsammans!
* En professionell miljö där din erfarenhet, kunskap och inställning tar oss ett steg vidare och möjligheten för dig att växa vidare.
* En central kontorsplats med bra kommunikationsmöjligheter.
* Dessutom en sund balans mellan arbete och fritid (smart arbete) och tid för att utveckla din profession.
* Hos Vattenfall får du möjlighet att arbeta för ett företag inom ren energi som strävar efter att skapa fossilfri energi inom en generation.
* Och sist men inte minst: en internationell och mångkulturell arbetsmiljö med energiska och motiverade kollegor som också gillar att ha roligt!


 Mer information: Vi välkomnar din ansökan på engelska, inklusive CV och personligt brev via vår webbplats senast den 31 juli 2023. För information om tjänsten, kontakta rekryteringschef Emile Das, +31 6 5250 4359. För mer information om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterare Folmer Koper +31 6 38710915.
   

  

 Vi på Vattenfall är övertygade om att strävan efter mångfald hjälper oss att bygga ett mer lönsamt, effektivt och attraktivt företag. Vi fortsätter att sträva efter en harmonisk balans av medarbetare när det gäller kön, ålder, etnisk och kulturell bakgrund.
   

  

 Eftersom Vattenfall är en del av den svenska samhällsviktiga infrastrukturen är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Om denna position är säkerhetsklassad kan slutkandidaterna bli föremål för en säkerhetsprövning enligt svensk lagstiftning.
   

  

 Mer information

 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Inom Vattenfallkoncernen finns cirka 20 000 anställda. Vi har elektrifierat industrier, levererat energi till bostäder och förvandlat tillvaron genom innovation i över hundra års tid. Vi vill nu göra det möjligt att leva fossilfritt inom en generation och vi driver på övergången till ett hållbart energisystem.

title: Senior Rewards Consultant
company_industry: Insurance and Business Consulting and Services
description:
Ready to be part of a company that is not only leading the market but transforming in the most exciting way? In Sweden, we are a team of experts who believe in building brighter futures for our clients and community by redefining the world of work.
   

  

 Our Rewards practice specializes in providing best-in-class compensation and benefits consulting services, advising our clients on a wide range of issues that directly impact their business, from reward strategies to executive compensation and performance management.
   

  

**What can you expect?**
**As a Senior Consultant** 
 , you will play a crucial role in leading and delivering rewards consulting projects while providing exceptional services to our clients. Your expertise will be highly valued as you lead complex consulting projects and offer strategic recommendations to address a wide range of client issues. We also appreciate your willingness to expand your knowledge and extend your exposure to future projects related to our Transformation Services, including skills-powered organizations, HR transformation, organization design, and change management.
   

  

 In the projects we deliver to our clients, you will have the opportunity to take on various roles and responsibilities. Some examples of these roles include:
   

  

* Developing Reward Strategies & Policies Help our clients design innovative reward strategies through co-facilitating workshops and design sessions.
* Conducting Client Interviews Engage with CxOs and CHROs to understand their organization’s challenges and reward philosophy.
* Preparing and Presenting Project Outcomes Co-present project outcomes to HR leadership and provide recommendations supported by change management and implementation plans.
* Advising on Compensation & Benefits Structures Conduct diagnostics of current and target reward models (as-is & to-be state) and research best market practices to create solid recommendations and solutions.


**What is in it for you?**
* A career with development opportunities and the possibility to work on key projects and top global client portfolios (NYSE/Nasdaq companies, Fortune 500).
* The opportunity to collaborate with highly skilled professionals renowned for their expertise in delivering exceptional services.
* A challenging and rewarding role with a leading global consulting firm.
* A supportive and collaborative team environment.
* A professional growth path that teaches you new technical skills for a better understanding of business and the rewards environment.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.


**We will count on you to:**
* Demonstrate a Commercial Mindset Build strong relationships with clients, gaining their trust and providing expert guidance and recommendations.
* Manage Multiple Projects Demonstrate your exceptional project management skills by efficiently managing multiple projects simultaneously.
* Facilitate Client Meetings Facilitate client meetings (e.g., workshops, focus groups, and other collaborative sessions) and act as a trusted advisor to clients (in presence or remote).
* Conduct and Deliver High-Quality Analysis and Presentations Utilize your analytical skills to conduct thorough analysis and deliver high-quality presentations, reports, and other deliverables to effectively communicate findings, recommendations, and progress to clients.
* Focus on Client Retention Nurture existing accounts by proactively maintaining day-to-day client relationships, ensuring their satisfaction, and addressing any concerns or challenges that may arise.
* Thrive in a Team-Based Environment Collaborate effectively with colleagues, fostering a culture of teamwork, accountability, and mutual support.
* Stay Up-to-Date with Industry Trends and Share Insights Stay informed about industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in rewards consulting, and share knowledge and insights with clients and colleagues.


**What you need to have:**
* Higher education: Degree level in Management, Economics, HR, or equivalent.
* 5+ years of experience preferably in Compensation and Benefits, HR, and Rewards consulting.
* Consultative client-facing experience: Experience in consulting firms with a focus on rewards consulting, compensation structures, or a related field with demonstrated ability to build strong relationships.
* Excellent command of English and Swedish: Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Advanced proficiency in MS Office programs: Particularly Excel, with the ability to manipulate and present data accurately and efficiently.
* Strong interpersonal skills: Ability to interact across all levels of the organization.
* Effective time management: Ability to manage multiple & changing priorities, meet deadlines, and deliver consistently high-quality work.
* Analytical and problem-solving skills: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights and recommendations.
* Attention to detail and accuracy: Essential for both numerical and written work.


**What makes you stand out:**
* Experience with HR consulting: Direct experience working with clients, providing HR consulting services.
* Knowledge of Agile project management methodology.
